<rating>4<//rating>< Text>
A sports-bar by day and the closest thing Arcata has to a nightclub by night.

On Friday and Saturday night be prepared to pay a $2 cover for entry into a bar full of college students and young adults. They have the only dance floor in town that plays top 40, hip hop, and dub step. Most weekends you can find this place packed with all kinds of different people.

This should be a 3 star bar for the weak drinks, but I gave them 4 stars for security. There are some bars in Humboldt I don't feel comfortable going to because there are too many bar fights and that ruin the night. Sidelines has amazing security! Many of them play Football at HSU and use their size to keeping the peace.<//Text>

<Date>1601169770972<//Date><Rate>5< /Rate><Resp>None<//Resp>< review>
I stopped by as I returned home from a camping trip. It was around 5am, I didnt know anything more than the sign read " open" and the reviews were generally good.  I walked in and they were making the donuts fresh right before my eyes! the layout is open and the kitchen visible from the counter, nothing to hide here.

I ate three raised donuts, that morning, two plain glazed and one maple, and they were practically perfect.  I dream of those donuts often, and hope this wild ride of life brings me there once more.</review>

< review>
Super friendly and quick service. Donuts fresh, competent, and good value. We fed my mom a birthday-breakfast Apple fritter that she loved, and the moist, dense, not-too-sweet cake almost won over my die-hard team-raised daughter. Merced is increasingly a college town; we were in and out quickly but I really appreciated the zero-hipster vibe, without a hint of intolerance from the regulars. Part of why I love the valley!<//review>

<Rating>5<//Rating><text>Great place for hu tieu nam vang. You choice between dry or in soup and different noodle options. I go with dry with thin rice noodle. Throw extra chrysanthemum greens in with the noodles and go to town. It's affordable and good. You could also order a soup bowl of bone with marrow or yao tieu/Chinese fried dough for a few bucks more.

Also tried the hot pot which I think is a solid deal for a lot of food. I prefer hu tieu though.</text><Pictures>None< /Pictures>< Resp>

<user>114792394372639145600< /user><name>Hanh N< /name><date>1543783647223</date>< Rate>
2</Rate>
< review>
After seeing so many + reviews on Yelp and Google, we decided to stop by and try their Hu Tieu. Sadly this is one of the worst Hu Tieu we ever had. Only the "soft" noodles version is available, not the "chewy" ones. We ordered our noodles with the broth served separately. The broth was so salty, the protein ingredients accompanying the noodles are plain and tasteless.
Either you don't know better what is good Hu Tieu, don't fall for the false reviews. Very disappointed!<//review>

< rate>
4<//rate>
< Review>
Good hu tieu, forgot to bring cash, but thankfully there is an ATM around the corner. There is a bit of a language barrier. Good food for the price, the Thai tea has a nice flavor, to be perfectly honest I'm not sure what gives it it's flavor. Not the best on customer service due to the language barrier, but we were provided with everything we needed to enjoy our meal and not asked every five minutes how the meal is, so on the flip side it was nice to enjoy our meal in peace. The fresh basil, cabbage, and bean sprouts was good.</Review>

<UserId.>100803858012841855744<//UserId.>< username>
Calvin Mensonides</username>
< date>
1498833875648</date>
<rating>1< /rating>< Review>
Came here the other week. They were out of a few items on the menu, like onion rings and a they were not serving beer, Wife tried to order a pulled pork sandwich, out of that too. A well run restaurant should never run out of stock. That should have been our first clue. We both ordered one of the burgers on the menu with fries. Burger was bland, didnt have any real flavor to it. Was susposed be cooked medium... came out well done. for a 12$ premium price point I would expect a lot more.  For a bill of close to 30 dollars ( 2 burgers and tip) SAVE your money and go else where.  Half of the fries were mushy, like they were really old.  Wait staff was nice and friendly, so we tipped accordingly.  After leaving on our way out noticed the yellow sign in the window for ownership change... so liquor licence was being update, but we were not told that... If you're looking for a premium burger joint, I'd go elsewhere.<//Review>

<gmapID>0x80c32de510cf07d3:0xc715e2afe8deb220<//gmapID><review>Pleasantly surprised about this little gem hidden in Pomona! I really wish there was one in LA....maybe one day.  The vibe here is super chill and the service was awesome. Our waitress was super sweet and very diligent.

We came in here two different times in the same day it was just that awesome. I had the Fall Harvest Cider on both occasions and was undeniably in love.  The cider had notes of pumpkin that subtly sweet but not as much as an apple cider. It provided a nice buzz as well!

The food here is also as exotic as its beers/ciders. The menu pairs every item with the perfect beer, how convenient. I had the Stinking Rose Fries which had this amazing garlic butter drizzled upon it. My brother has the bacon burger and loved it! I was far too full off the cider to even delve into the burgers. They did have a Crust Crab burger worth mentioning. I will have to make another trip for this fascinating sounding burger.

If you share a picture of your experience via Instragram, Facebook or Twitter then you get a percentage off. Not sure exactly but it was about a dollar or so off the entire bill.  It's certainly worth checking out if you're in the area. They have plenty of big screens so it's perfect for sport gazing.<//review><username>Jenelle Bossett</username><rate>4< /rate>< UserId.>

<gmap_id>0x80c32de510cf07d3:0xc715e2afe8deb220<//gmap_id><username>Felipe Castillo< /username>< Response>

<date>1490838757849</date>< rating>

<Pics>None<//Pics><userid>105632985685210235123<//userid></record></dataset><record>
< pics>
None< /pics>
<rate>5<//rate>< review>
Food: 5/5 stars
Yum. Gourmet burgers. House made Pastrami duck on burger with mustard aioli... (My mouth hurts just from saying that! And having to take a bite out of such a thick burger). Must be a foodie word... "Aioli." Cooked perfect medium.  The black and blue cheese burger was also excellent. Darn fine garlic fries. Good selection of tap beer.  Maybe its the beer typing right now.

Atmosphere: 5/5 stars
Brickwalled, Casual, industrial, trendy warehouse conversion to bar feel type of place. 4 TVs on four walls with sport Chanel. Toe tapping Bob Marley music playing over the speakers (with sub woofer for some fine bass lines).... Buffalo soldieeeeeeers.... (Calling all audiophiles).

Service: 5/5 stars
I couldn't decide on beers. The waitress (Melodie, a fine women) recommended a few ..... And brought me samples.  10 stars.

Expense: 4/5 stars
5% discount for posting picture on FB. Even so it was $20+ for food, drink, tax, tip per person. A bit high for burgers, but... It was a gentrified fusion gourmet burger, so there!

Return: 5/5 stars
I have already returned. So there.<//review>

<name>Juvi Guevara< /name><time>1447570267532< /time>< response>
None</response>
< Rate>
4< /Rate>
< Pictures>
None<//Pictures>
<review>This may be one of the finer burger houses this side of LA, and definitely worth hitting up if you're in the area for one of the Artwalks or other slew of events that go on in this bustling part of P-Town.

The space is modest, but always hopping, with sports aplenty being shown on every wall. The booze menu is amazing, and being a sweets lover myself, I have to say their list of ciders is up there with the best. Their Summer Blueberry Cider and Pineapple Cider are every sweet tooth's dream come true. If you're a stout lover, like my crazy friend, you will love their Voodoo Stout; with it's robustness and hefty alcohol content, it may sneak up on you, depending on how high your tolerance is. They also have plenty of wine for the connoisseurs who enjoy the finer things in life, and craft beers for those who... well, don't. And don't even get me started on everything they have on tap.

Regardless of what you decide to drink- and trust me, you have a wall's worth of drinks to choose from- the food is probably the biggest reason to come. The burgers, in particular, pack a lil' something extra to make your visit memorable. If you want my advice, try the Cremini Mushroom Burger, which brings together the juiciness of high-quality beef, the savoriness of sauteed mushrooms & caramelized onions, and... wait for it... the sweetness of Goji. Berry. Jam. It is one delicious burger. Throw in some pretzel sticks with a side of their melty cheese sauce, or onion rings, and let's not forget the free milkshake with your Yelp check-in for dessert, and you have yourself the perfect nighttime binge meal.

But, yeah, the booze is amazing.< /review>< user>
115563457627389021310<//user>

<user_id>114355522246094558955</user_id></record></dataset><record>
<response>None<//response><username>Chris C< /username>< Text>
Most of the artists and the receptionist are friendly, but it's because of the management's attitude towards customer service that I can no longer recommend Art Junkies, especially when there are so many great options in the nearby area.

My wife went in to get a tattoo from another shop fixed, and was very specific that a certain part was not to be touched- it was the only part she liked on the original. For some reason, the artist did that part anyways and it looked so bad that people commented on it! I went into the shop and talked to one of the artists who told me that we had three options: laser removal to get the part lightened then fixed, trying to lighten it with white ink or trying creams- I told him that we would try the laser option. My wife also posted her displeasure on their facebook page, but it was removed. This would have been a great time for them to tell us about the "hidden" requirement to show the owner the tattoo before getting the work done, but this didn't happen.

So my wife had several painful laser sessions before we go in to have the tattoo looked at for repairs. That's when they tell us that the repair will be new work because "we didn't show them first!" Even though I came in before the sessions, at no time were we told to do that and that was never given as a condition. The owner only added this requirement after the fact, even though we were acting on THEIR advice and doing exactly what we were told. All we wanted was the parts that weren't supposed to be done in the first place fixed, but the owner refused even though they made the error.

Ultimately, after much argument, we were given a refund for the original work. It's a shame, because we had intended on getting several more pieces done there. I suppose it wasn't worth it to the owner.<//Text>

<review>Shary has done it again! Being new to the area, having daughters, finding a new hair salon is a mission to find. You just don't know what you will get with a new hairdresser.

Shary is absolutely amazing. We made appointments spread out within a few weeks, as trials, and to get to know Shary.  She has exceeded my hopes of having a good haircut.

Shary gives even, symmetrical, polished haircuts. Period. I only highlight my hair twice a year and starting to embrace my grey coming in. Being a (naturally) sun bleached blonde, I'm impatient when it comes to roots and the winter months. Shary knew exactly what to do. It's not over processed, not fake blonde looking, but blended beautifully.

<user_name>‡º∫ Phoenix Down ‡ºª< /user_name>< review>
This salon has been the best salon I've ever been to. Heres why:

1.) Workers actually know what they're doing, and they seemed very well trained and experienced.

2.) They ask for a reference picture right away, and put effort into making it look like the picture.

3.) They give warnings and advice about bleached hair.

4.) There products for bleached hair are fairly cheap and work very well.

5.) They don't rush. When you're getting your hair bleached, it must sit for a while before doing the rest of the steps for dying your hair.

I'm positive that there's a lot more reasons why this salon rocks compared to the rest, but by far, in my opinion, this is thr best salon I've been to.< /review>

< review>
They used to host the most amazing brunch on the planet. The interior design is awe inspiring and the kind of beautiful charm you imagine 1920s San Francisco would have been back in the day. My once upon a time city is becoming too gentrified, too renovated, and too expensive, but there are some places worth looking at, and The Palace is one.</review>

<Date>1552779367456< /Date>< user_id>
105386143067383095480< /user_id>
<rate>5< /rate>< Text>
Came here for a Saturday afternoon tea for our sister's birthday! Absolutely phenomenal service. I know everyone on Yelp was saying service wasn't great, but we had one of the best experiences ever. Hats off to Aida! Aida was our server and her and Louisa did an amazing job with our service. With vegetarians, vegans, and picky eaters in general, they went above and beyond to ensure the foods were sufficient for each person. Food was delicious! My favorites had to have been the scones with the various creams and jams.

Antonio was also extremely nice and hospitable.

For our birthday girl, they got her a little special cake and gave her this adorable tiara because of the whole palace theme.

Highly highly highly recommend this place for special occasions or for even a fun afternoon! Great for all ages and males and females!

Pro tip: make reservations in advance. 2pm time is better bc less busy, 4pm was packed!</Text>

< review>
We love staying at the Palace Hotel. It‚Äôs part of the Luxury Collection by Marriott, so you cannot go wrong. With most of the rooms being recently updated, you‚Äôll get a modern bathroom with a bidet, and the most comfiest bed! I also love their hair care products. The only drawback are the windows aren‚Äôt soundproof (they appear to be older) so you can hear honking and sirens if you‚Äôre on the lower levels. Try to request a room on one of the upper levels if possible. The brunch buffet is delicious and there are many options for everyone. Highly recommend. Even if you don‚Äôt eat here, have a cocktail during Happy Hour and enjoy the beautifully restored 100-year old glass ceiling. This is where The Game with Michael Douglas was filmed, if you remember that scene of him crashing through the ceiling. Also, make sure you use a parking app to find the lowest-priced parking options because their parking is not cheap.< /review>

<Date>1559255765862</Date><username>Mercy Peterson</username><Review>This is a posh hotel! You cant get a free continental breakfast here (it's $30), but the pool and fitness areas are very nice, and the room was clean with nice towels, 2 good robes, slippers, a fantastic shower head, and free wifi.

Elevators and other common areas require a room key for access, so make sure your key is on you! < user_name>
Cook & Fly< /user_name>
<Date>1597826100420</Date>< rating>
4<//rating>
< text>
@cooknfly
We stayed at Palace Hotel for a couple of nights and I just wish we stayed longer because the hotel is beautiful, this hotel is part of The Luxury Collection Hotels from Marriott so go figure! it was build over 100 years ago and the architecture impressive! The rooms are beautifully renovated and so cosy the bed was a 10 out 10! So soft and inviting.

There was a big cafe in the ground floor looking like a royal hall, the staff was extremely friendly at reception, we had help with the bags all the way to our suite and the only thing I wasn‚Äôt fully happy with was the view from our window but was a minor thing really, because we spent the whole day visiting the city, we only spend the night time at the hotel.

The corridors are decorated with some vintage furniture and botanical flowers, there is coffee, tea and hot water for free in the mornings. One thing we didn‚Äôt expect was the parking spots! They don‚Äôt have a parking area, is quite an expensive hotel and so we expected to find parking near buy or included but it was the case, apparently most of the hotels in San Francisco don‚Äôt have a parking area.

Overall : 9/10

For more content, checkout @cooknfly on Instagram.

Stay safe.< /text>

< Review>
Palace Hotel is our favorite hotel in San Francisco. It's a great value and the perfect location to get anywhere in the city. The rooms are beautiful. Bright bathrooms, big showers and comfortable beds. When you see the lobby, restaurant and ballrooms, you'll agree it is a Palace.< /Review>

<Date>1564790421192</Date>< Review>
This is one of the best (and many) Marriott properties I've been to. Very elegant hotel, great location, excellent service, neat room, wonderful gym and spa, access to the Ghiradelli store from within. I really enjoyed the week.
Unfortunately, I didnt get a chance to try the breakfast. Went to the Pied Piper bar downstairs, which was also quite nice. The only area of improvement is that at Pied Piper, service could have been a little better.</Review>

< text>
The decor was beautiful. The lobby was gorgeous- and the hallways to the rooms were bright and well lit (and a little reminiscent of the original Shining movie üòé)- it was not what I considered true luxury because once we entered our 'upgraded' room we found our cabinet doors were wonky and would not close without some manipulation, the bathroom sink slow drained (no pic because I can't get the video to post) and the interior of the ice room was dirty. The Buffet was too cold - cold, runny Eggs Benedict and half cold greasy bacon and sausage - no, no, no! Plus the wait staff all seemed to have attitude. The one saving grace was the cleaning crew. They were smiling all day every day - and willing to do whatever you asked of them.<//text>

Very comfy, high ceiling room for two but with only a smallish bath. We had a nice view of the city skyline with the Salesforce tower. Architecturally the hotel is noted for its turn of the century glass and ironwork domed atrium.  Breakfast was served there and it was extra good giving us time to enjoy the space. The one surprise we had was the $87 local room tax for a one night stay!!< /Text>

<time>1541339208057</time><rate>4</rate><Review>Stayed here for a business meeting in the Financial District. I was hesitant to book here because I normally prefer new hotels, but the renovated room I got was quite nice: it retained the historical feel but with updated facilities, including convenient electrical outlets at the desk and near the bed. The room had high ceilings, but the bathroom was indeed small, particularly very little counter space. The sink also did not drain well. There were loud protests outside - day and night - from a labor dispute that had been ongoing for most of October, involving 80% of the hotel's employees! Fortunately I was given a room away from the street, but it did affect the ability to go in and out from the front - or sometimes even the side doors.< /Review>< Pics>

<username>peter kirk< /username><Text>Very cool, old style hotel.  High ceiling rooms, very comfy beds.  And a bidet built into the toilet! Great breakfast buffet. < Date>
1577433407946< /Date>
<Rate>5</Rate><user>111495219028271756808<//user>< text>
This historic hotel oozes of history, opulence, and class. It's maintained as it was in it's yester glory days with modern fittings and amenities in the rooms. The entrance area and the Grand Court are spectacular to look at and the Christmas decorations (as we were there during Christmas) were amazing as well.

What really stands apart is the customer service - from the front staff, to the housekeeping, the Bell staff, and to the staff at the Pied Piper and restaurants - everyone came together in providing just amazing service. This is what really added to the old world charm of this hotel and made our stay wonderful.

Great location - right next to Bart (Montgomery), and centrally located in San Fran. The rooms were not huge but decent sized for our needs. Bathrooms were large enough with bidets built in.
Food was very good everywhere from the restaurants to room service.
Having an evening drink at the Pied Piper was a classic experience with the ambiance that never goes out of style. Having a Ghirardelli onsite is an added bonus.</text>

< user_name>
Alexander Cusworth< /user_name>
< date>
1581225541424</date>
< Rating>
5< /Rating>
< Text>
Simply a wonderful experience, even if it was brief. Given the change I would definitely return. The service from start to finish was excellent. Check-in was quick and friendly. Got to a comfortable and luxurious room, even if it was one of the more basic ones. Bathroom wasn't large but it was well equipped. The water pressure was good for such an old building. On my trip, this was the only hotel I truly got a good night's rest in.
They even have an evening turn down service. Even included a little chocolate. Who gives out chocolates anymore? They were also always loading me up on water bottles, more water bottles. While nice, I would hope to see bottle fillers replace so many of the plastic bottles.
I also stayed for a Saturday breakfast buffet which was very well loaded with a variety of options. A good number of items from local shops. Great to see them supporting local businesses.
All in all it was a wonderful stay and I hope to return. With cars no longer on that portion of market Street it's much quieter and a great location.</Text>

<Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id><Time>1571542051266<//Time><Text>Can you point your nose straight up in the air? Do you like miniature food? How about and insanely gaudy crystal and gold laden room? Then let me tell you about Saturday afternoon tea at the Palace Hotel...first they sit you down and arrive with a plate of four fruits, not whole fruits, but four bites of fresh fruit and get your tea order. Second, you're presented with four slivers of sandwiches ( sprouts on one, smoked salmon on another, turkey on a third and squash on the fourth) which were flavorful, but did they ever leave me hungry. Third, the desserts, which again were flavorful, but it looks like they could feed a small bird, not a 6'4" humanoid... it's a good thing Wendy's was open. I don't understand the afternoon tea thing, but the food was good so I was glad to partake.< /Text>< user_id>

<text>I absolutely love the Palace Hotel which is one of the most beautiful in the world. Old world elegance meets modern convenience.  I wanted to sit in the lobby for ours just to admire the architecture and art. I felt like I was in Paris. Rooms had upgraded, modern bathrooms which blended with the historical elements of the hotel without clashing. The only thing that needed modern change was the menu which was not vegan-friendly. Otherwise, we would have spent even more time in the hotel.< /text><pics>None< /pics>< Response>

< name>
AileeJ<//name>
<time>1578441600000<//time>< rating>
None</rating>
< Text>
Even though the hotel was bustling with guests and throwing a party- the rooms provided tranquil respite and noise was not bad at all. We faced Market St on 7th floor and it was quite quiet. In room service for food and drink were accurate in their time quotes and drinks were well worth the price. Room service breakfast was delicious- but seemed it would have been even better if it arrived hot instead of just like warm- that being said it WAS NYE, so maybe just a lot going on. The beds and linens and toilet are divine! The grey lavender paint with minimalist classic molding won me over as I watched dawn come over the city. All in all- it felt like luxury! Would definitely stay again but maybe ask for a room with sunlight.< /Text>

1573516800000< /time>
<Rate>None< /Rate>< Review>
The Palace Hotel is beautifully restored and maintained.  The staff were very warm and helpful.  Our room was spacious but there was very little storage, no drawers or cabinets.  The bathroom was smallish but there was plenty of room for toiletries. My only complaint was that it was a little dark, and the water pressure was light. It was a rain shower with light pressure, so difficult to get a good rinse off. Also, the half shower door  tended to flood the room. 
Overall a wonderful stay though.</Review>

<userid>117174992497074442220<//userid>< Name>
KKD City</Name>
<date>1573791070494< /date>< Rating>
3< /Rating>
< Review>
Once the famous Sheraton Palace Hotel now, simply  the Palace Hotel...is still Breathtaking. Last weekend, we had a small gathering and enjoyed High Tea in the main lobby level area.
First,  our friendly waitress Delivered for pots of tea. Each different -most of us were looking for decaf. Note: The teapots weigh a ton! They are filled to the brim and very difficult to pour.
I have no idea what the per person-cost was for the high tea, but I would think that the waitress might serve some of the tea.
Everyone received four delicious, little, tea sandwiches. More tea was delivered.Tried to wave the waitress down to get a new napkin but she was busy chatting. Her assistant seemed distracted.
Desserts were tiny ...and delicious.
Very popular.<//Review>

<user_id>None</user_id><user_name>Eyesofmad<//user_name><time>1584489600000<//time><Rate>None</Rate>< Text>
The Palace Hotel is very beautiful and decorated in a classic period style. However the rooms are quite small. Our room‚Äôs door opened right into the room, no entry hallway. We had a minor upgrade to a room that had a view of Market Street. That also included the noise of Market Street. Thankfully we aren‚Äôt super light sleepers. 

The bathroom was also very small. The toilet had a bidet seat which was nice but the shower didn‚Äôt look very thoroughly cleaned as the tile had some staining. It was also very small. 

The pool area (which The Palace is the only Marriott in the downtown area with a pool) Is beautiful with the windowed ceiling! The pool was a little chilly for our liking. We did use the hot tub but it was kind of small. There were 4 people in it and anymore would have been a little cramped. 

We were provided with an umbrella one day which was very helpful.   

Location wise it was very close to Chinatown and the shopping on Market Street. It sits in the financial district so I am sure this hotel is great for business travelers. The BART Montgomery Station drops you off right in front of the side doors into the hotel which was great.<//Text>

< review>
We had seven rooms booked at The Palace Hotel to celebrate my dad's 80th birthday.  From the moment we checked in with Jelly at the front desk to the moment we left with hugs from the valet, our stay could not have been made more special!  Great staff, perfect location, and again GREAT STAFF - the woman who served us drinks in the lobby (she was from China, I wish I remembered her name) she made us all feel so at home.  I will be back.  Thank you!!!< /review>

<text>Beautiful and recently renovated rooms. Excellent service.  Extremely comfortable beds. Fantastic buffet breakfast ($49/person).  Dinner menu in the bar is a bit limited and static, especially for frequent business travelers.<//text><Name>Rob Berardinelli</Name><user>108478388661041033720<//user></record>
</dataset><record>
<user>108616358951119292360</user><username>Lottie Clementson<//username>< Time>
1580577059916< /Time>
< rate>
3< /rate>
< review>
This is supposed to be the most top end luxury hotel. It looks glamorous when you walk in and the main hall is beautiful but the hotel itself was a bit disappointing. The room was quite dark and dingy and a bit run down. The wardrobe doors wouldn't stay shut. The bathroom hadn't been cleaned properly there were shaving hairs on the shelf and glasses. There was two free water bottles in the room. Reception were helpful, they got the bathroom sorted out and gave us one free morning breakfast. Shame that was a bit disappointing too. The staff looked overstretched and weren't exactly friendly or helpful. You get offered coffee and orange juice but not tea. Had to find someone to help me get a pot of tea as they rushed off before I could ask. Reasonable buffet with lots of choice but you can buy a better breakfast outside the hotel. Overall we didn't think the hotel was worth the money. The location is OK but not the easiest if you arrive in San Francisco for the first time. Fisherman's wharf or Union Square are easier. Buy a city pass for use on all public transport and big savings on entry to attractions.</review>

<user>103855841787390875374<//user><user_name>Kit Parker< /user_name><date>1556972505871<//date><rating>4<//rating><text>A pretty good old hotel and a nice location in downtown San Francisco. You're right around the corner from a Walgreens and a Starbucks. pool and hot tub and workout facilities are really good. The curious thing is there is no coffee in the room. That's usually not a bad thing and a Marriott because they're in room coffee services some of the nastiest coffee on the planet, but in this hotel if you want to have coffee in your room they will bring a Keurig machine to your room. So bring your own keurig cups.
Parking is limited down here so think twice about renting a car. You can Uber everywhere and you're within a mile walking distance of most of the major attractions and the downtown area.<//text><pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMOkQf2ajsNWdAcM-L2KkSsrqwv2RtIOy_5DTbX=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNtiWCRLoqs6pFq72OsFx6H1d4bHHkgXRk5DOh0=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOjwP2vcm-_f0KgSoGOoNX2wfAXiG52vpXv2mT2=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMb__6R5XaXiuXBcsfVD3IuuPQ0BeQ4iXyW6Eol=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipM3us1K0GIsYNwVBEuqIxgXyZ7d-U-3tZ3HwVM9=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNp1beD1xSl_NfMAmMExtidAJvfJt5qDAG47XXN=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNoUSXQtWNVI5indukRcEBgCRVzNx_GATGRIWHH=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]< /pics>< Response>

<user>None<//user><response>None<//response><Time>1578528000000</Time><Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id><rate>None<//rate><username>Kyle</username>< Text>
Beautiful hotel, great location, close to all public transportation, MUNI & BART just outside, with cable cars just a short block away. Our room was clean and the hotel has an overall grand feeling about it. Lots to do nearby, restaurants, movie theater, civic center, nightlife and museums. Can't stress the location enough, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy San Francisco. No hidden resort fees or nightly imposed fees, I personally don't stay at any hotel that has those. Overall a 10 out of 10.</Text>

<Name>A Gandhi< /Name><Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id><user>113933161029924462512< /user>< text>
The Palace Hotel is an all round great hotel with friendly staff in the heart of San Francisco. The most appealing part of the hotel is the beautiful lounge area that can be seen on the second picture on my post.  This lounge area has been well-maintained since the hotel originally opened and is a fantastic spot to grab a coffee or a quick snack. The hotel also has a pretty fantastic bar called Pied Piper which, is definitely worth a visit. The hotel rooms themselves are fairly nice with high ceilings and the bed I had was comfortable enough (6 out of 10).  All in all, this hotel is worth a stay if you prioritize location and a historic setting and it is definitely a better value than other comparably priced hotels in the area.</text>

< Review>
First, this is a beautiful hotel. I had a corner suite on the 4th floor. There were several fails, starting from the first day. The bathroom had several long hairs on the floor, which I asked housekeeping to clean up, which they did. The next morning, I saw more long hairs in the shower, which I simply washed down the drain. In 5 days, the minibar was refreshed exactly once. Housekeeping also left an icebucket of melted ice one day, rather than emptying it. The phones' speed dial for service did not work, leading me to call the hotel as an outside number to be transferred to someone who could help. The living room furniture was uncomfortable and awkwardly arranged. I rearranged the furniture for my stay to make the room functional. No one offered help with my luggage upon arrival, nor offered to show me to my room and show me the amenities. The internet can be intermittant at times, shocking, given that you're in SF.< /Review>

<Rating>None<//Rating><Review>This hotel is certainly palatial. It‚Äôs very easy to be taken aback by the shear grandeur of the spaces. 

It was Thanksgiving weekend, so the hotel was nearly at capacity and it showed. It was a bit overwhelming to experience hordes of crowds with check-in & breakfast lines a mile long. The hotel felt understaffed. Once reaching a staff member is reached, they‚Äôre very polite and helpful. 

I really enjoyed the Byredo bath amenities, but the suite that I was checked-into had a half-drunk soda bottle still in the room. Luggage took several hours and multiple phone calls. 

The hotel was renovated in 2015, but the interior designer chose to go a more modern direction with the furniture, which is a bit of a shame. 

Overall, it was a nice experience and I‚Äôd stay at the Palace again.</Review>< Pics>

< text>
Work and family bring us back to San Francisco frequently, and the Palace Hotel has quickly become a home away from home. From the building to the staff, everything about the Palace is a welcome reprieve from the hussle of the city outside. 

Don't pass up breakfast. The morning spread in the Garden Court far exceeds expectations for the usual Bonvoy offering.</text>

<Text>Overall, this property does not come close to other Luxury collections I have stayed. The location is excellent though close to a MUNI and BART station. Have honestly received better friendlier service at properties with fewer stars.< /Text>< pictures>

<Text>Fancy hotel with very clean rooms - as expected of a hotel in its price range. My only wish is the rooms to be a little bigger, but it's a very minor complaint.  The central air worked well and was quiet.  The toilets are elongated with an integrated bidet.  The interior fit and finish was good as well.  The staff is very helpful and provided us a lot of local recommendations to do near the hotel.  I did not try the restaurant but I was told it gets very busy especially for breakfast with a 30-45 minute wait on the weekends.  Would stay again at this hotel.<//Text>< Pictures>

< name>
BondO</name>
<Time>1568764800000</Time>< Rating>
None< /Rating>
<text>It is deserving of being part of the luxury collection association.
The valets picking up the vehicle are nice and helpful.
Although I didn't use the bell service, they were right one standby.
The reception desk is a bit small but that doesnt detract from the service they provide.
The inside lounge/lobby area is beautiful.
The hallways of the interior are a bit plain and generic, a little freaky after watching IT 2.
The rooms are fantastic, very clean and modernized.
Bed was nice and firm, clean sheets, fluffy pillows. But they make a good bit of noise during activities.
Walls in between seem to hold sound well, I don't know if other guests could hear us but we couldn't hear them from inside the room. The Bathroom is very nice, comes with a bidet and a shower head that towers over my head and I'm 72 inches tall.
The room service and amenities were spot on.</text>< Pictures>

<review>Amazing Hotel especially if you love historic buildings.  Very modern amenities mixed with a classic hotel style you don't see any more.  Location is great for food shopping and only a 20 minute walk to the Piers.  Rooms are exactly how they appear on the website and very classic and upscale architecture/features.  Our experience with the staff was amazing. Everyone was very helpful, courteous and prompt.  San Francisco is a very "unique" place and if ever go back, The Palace would be my first choice.  Beware if you drive.....you could check you car into a Motel 6 for cheaper than it cost to park there.<//review>< Response>

This hotel has old charm and modernized convenience. So close to all the attractions but very quiet. Staffs are friendly and willing to help you. < review>
Overall its a nice historic hotel with a very beautiful lobby. They seem to be significantly understaffed which lead to issues at check-in and the valet. Upon arrival at 4pm our room was not ready and 1 1/2 hours later we were still waiting. We finally received a room but it was not the upgraded room we booked online. The room itself is small, which is not unexpected in a historic property but it didnt have basic amenities either, such as power at the desk or a mirror in the room which made it challenging for two people to get ready at the same time. The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable however.< /review>

< review>
I was satisfied with the room, cleanliness, possibility to check in early, the impressive interiors of the lobby etc. 
I was not impressed by the lack of proper info at check in on change of internet password during the stay and the fact that the lobby entrance would be blocked out for guests (!) completely on the night of our arrival. There are guests who do not speak English and explanations by a doorman later on were confusing and unnecessary (entering through a mase of a bar etc), as it was literally 10m to reach the lifts from the entrance so it could be fenced for guests to make life easy. Unfortunately it spoilt the impression of being welcomed as a guest in the hotel or being some kind of a priority for the hotel mamagement. Which in my opinion is one the top objectives for a hotel of this class (if not for any hotel).</review>

<rate>5< /rate><Date>1573960631412<//Date><text>My daughter and I took our annual quick getaway to San Francisco this past year. I get a companion pass every year on Delta so we chose SFO. I booked the Palace through American Express' Fine Hotels & Resorts program because it offered a guaranteed 4pm checkout and a $100 amenity credit - among other benefits.

We left (from Vegas) after I got off work but because of a connection in L.A., we didn't have in San Francisco until almost 10pm. By the time we got to the hotel, it was almost 11. The reason I bring this up is because we were planning on having dinner at the Pied Piper. The posted hours show it being open until midnight daily - and it was - but they don't serve their dinner menu until midnight.

We were disappointed but ordered room service and it was pretty awesome. But getting back to the hotel - it's beautiful and oozes history. The Garden Court is absolutely stunning..... it's palatial (get it, palatial and we're starting at the Palace). The rooms are large and elegant as well. Our room didn't have a view but because of the hotel's location, I'm sure some rooms have amazing views.

We also didn't have time to eat the provided breakfast because we left early to hit the sights so can't comment on it. We made the usual rounds since it was my daughter's first time in San Francisco and this is where the 4pm checkout is super helpful. We were able to spend the entire day in the city, get back to the room and shower, and still get to the airport comfortably.

I loved everything about our stay but hope to stay longer next time, eat at the Pied Piper, and have breakfast in the Garden Court. We both enjoyed our experience at the Palace Hotel!< /text>< response>

<Response>None< /Response>< Review>
During check-in, there was a heavy line up with only two staff in the front attending customers and the wait was roughly 20 minutes long. If there was more staff during the check-in process, it would have made the whole experience for folks traveling far a lot smoother.  Upon arrival, I was told a room was not ready for an early check-in. I notified them I was an elite Gold Bonvoy member and requested an early check-in. However, the Montgomery room I booked was not ready; and I had to settle for a downgrade for the only room available as my wife was tired and pregnant and didn't want to wait for the room. So not only did we have to wait a long time to get served, but we also didn't get the room we expected, and wasn't able to get an early check in. I was told by the original desk attendant that I would be contact in an hour with an update on a room, but didn't hear anything and had to go back an hour later to ask if anything was available as well. The service was extremely poor and I was highly disappointed.

I typically don't leave negative reviews as I come to San Francisco every month for work and try all the Bonvoy Establishments to get a different experience and most if not all except for this one was fair and I was always left satisfied with the whole experience and service. 

Unfortunately, this experience did not live up to my expectations, and I've already booked another hotel for next month for my stay in San Francisco.</Review>

< rate>

< name>
Lulu</name>
< review>
The Palace Hotel used to be a destination, especially during holiday time. The grand holiday tree in the garden court was a sight to see. The decorations throughout the hotel were one of a kind and all spectacular. Today? Meh. The tree is a grouping of three small trees which are dwarfed by the room's size. Also, ugly beyond measure. The hotel is devoid of additional decorations and looks pretty darn sad. The Garden Court redo looks like it is set up like a train station but without the vintage look - just crowded with tables and during our stay which is usually a busy time, empty. Be aware that if you have a profile, no one might read it in advance to prepare your room accordingly. Also be prepared for little communication about hotel events that preclude your ability to either eat/drink at the bar or Garden Court because someone thought it a good idea to allow them to close both at the same time for private events leaving guests to either order room service or find somewhere else to eat at the last minute. It was so disappointing I'd never book the Palace again. What it once was, is gone. I really hope someone listens and brings back the awesomeness that made the Palace a destination. All it needs is someone to care. Also, it could use some help with allowing the staff to be more upbeat and accommodating. It's like their hands are tied by management. No one was unfriendly, but they sure weren't helpful. Big difference.</review>

< review>
This was my first visit to The Palace Hotel, and it exceeded expectations! The hotel common and dining spaces are beautiful (Garden Court and Pied Piper especially), and our room was lovely (not huge, but more than fair considering the hotel's central location). The front desk staff, concierge, and even housekeeping staff were all warmly welcoming. Hotel management was friendly and helpful, and sent an unexpected small birthday surprise up to my room! All in all, I enjoyed a wonderful weekend at The Palace Hotel, and would definitely return again.</review>

< name>
ASJ< /name>
<time>1571616000000<//time><rate>None< /rate>< Text>
Very good hotel. Clean, comfortable room & bed. En-suite was also very clean. Room was a bit noisy as we faced market street but overall experience was very good. Server that brought our room service up on the last day was a bit rude but when raised with manager, it was dealt with promptly. No English breakfast tea in the rooms, which is a bit inconvenient for tea drinkers like my husband and I. Also, we booked a room with breakfast for three but breakfast was only given for two. When we book bed and breakfast for 3 in a room, would expect to get breakfast for 3 as well, which, was a bit of a let down. Breakfast in the garden court restaurant was very good with a variety of selections. We ate at the Pied Piper restaurant as well and the food was very good. Kids menu is limited, though. Overall, very good hotel and would recommend it.<//Text>

Big fan of the Palace.  Beautiful lobby and common area.  Very spacious and comfortable rooms.  The Palace is not a boutique personal service hotel - it is big and you can expect a lot of folks in the bar and restaurant areas. It is a very lively and fun space to hang out, but the rooms are away from the din and are quiet. A rare combination and I applaud the Palace for achieving it.  Great location. Overall, an excellent choice albeit not an inexpensive one.</text>

< review>
A historic gem! An amazing property thats been updated with thoughtful details and design. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. 
Due to the hotels age, the rooms are a little smaller than a modern hotel. However, the design and cleanliness of the room more than make up for the size. 
The location is perfect  and has easy access to navigate the city. I took BART from SFO directly to the Montgomery Station, which is literally underneath the property. Super convenient and extremely easy.
You must have a drink in the Pied Piper Lounge and lunch in the Garden Court, just for the atmosphere alone. Absolutely stunning.
A beautiful building with a very nice staff. It was well worth the visit!</review>

<Review>I splurged and took 2 deluxe king rooms at the Palace Hotel, San Francisco for my son and myself for Christmas. I used my AAA discount and stayed only the nights my vacay money would afford. I researched and took enough cash for tips as well.

The hotel was beautifully decorated, the staff was extra cheery, friendly, and helpful and our rooms were exquisite. I chose the hotel from the photos of it's appealing historical architecture. I wanted a festive, nostalgic, Olde San Francisco ambience and this hotel delivered.

My son enjoyed the work out room and I enjoyed the pool and hot tub. We had in room service on Christmas morning and experienced friendly, courteous upscale dining.

The rooms had elegant architectural features and the baths were well equipped with high end features, and lovely bath amenities. 

We enjoyed chatting over drinks in the Pied Piper and picked up some Christmas Treats at the Giradelli on the corner without having to go outside in the rain.

My talented son played the grand piano in the lobby one night as we sat and enjoyed the architectural majesty of the Garden Court and the wonderfully decorated trees.

The staff was friendly and cheery and available at all times. 

We had a wonderful time and will probably go back.</Review><pictures>None<//pictures>< response>
None</response>

<date>1557014400000</date><Rating>None< /Rating><text>Regarding my recent stay at the palace hotel I have a serious concern.  I had to be at a meeting at 7am and wake up at 6am. The room next to me was full of kids that were yelling and screaming. I understand this is not the hotels fault and out of your control, but what happened next was shocking.  

I knocked on the door and asked them to be quiet. No one replied and they kept yelling.  I knocked again and they continued to ignore me. At that point I came back to my room and talked to the front, explained the concern, and was assured that they would take care of it immediately. I let them know that I had to be up very early and so it was urgent.

15 minutes went by and no one came to the door or called the room. I was standing by the door waiting and I heard nothing. At that point I remembered that when we checked in we asked for a coffee maker and said it was urgent as we had to leave. It took ONE HOUR for the coffee machine to arrive.  I realized at that point this was not a coincidence, but instead another symptom of poor management.

I then called again 15 minutes later and the front desk staff sounded like I caught him off guard and instead of apologize, he lied and said they came to the door but there was no noise so he didn't do anything. I was in the room waiting the entire time and so I know this was a straight out lie. I then asked to speak to someone else and he put me through to security. I talked to them and they assured me it would be dealt with immediately. Again 15 minute went by and nothing happened. No knock on the door, no phone call. I called back and once again LIES.  They told me they spoke to them and asked them to be quiet.  I was standing by the door and NO ONE knocked. Straight out lie.

I then called again and demanded to speak to the manager. He told me he would move me to another room. I told him I was in bed trying to sleep and for third time I am begging them to just ask the kids to be quiet.  He called security and got them to knock and the door and within minutes they were quiet, which further showed me that the first two times were straight out lies.

So my concern is not that the kids were making noise. That happens. My concern is that you staff did nothing and then LIED and said they did TWICE. They didn't care that I said I had to wake up early and needed to sleep. They were only concerned about pretending they did their job.  

I thought this was a 5 star hotel?< /text><Pics>None<//Pics><resp>None<//resp><gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb</gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

Corey</user_name>
<review>This hotel is definitely what you expect from a luxury 5-star hotel. The lobby and garden court are stunning. The rooms are super comfortable and well-designed. The bathroom smart toilet is wild, and a great feature! Overall this hotel is really nice and I would stay here again for sure. The only complaints I would have are that the WiFi is slow and unreliable, and the A/C never got very cold. I stayed during July when it was in the 60s outside, and the room was almost uncomfortably warm at times with no way to make the A/C cooler. Overall wonderful though!<//review><rate>None< /rate></record>

< Text>
Well, i was there for one night. The air conditioning wasnt working. I went to reception at 10 PM to complaint. went again at 10:30 I was told that they have notified the engineer and he is looking into it. I think afterwards i slept waiting. Woke up at midnight (sweating as it was 78), called the helpdesk. got the same response. Went back again at 12:30 and then a manager called an engineer to fix. Robert came up to fix it and it took him like 5 mins. It seems it was some known issue which he was aware of. Overall, i couldn't sleep thru out the night when i was there to just sleep for that night!</Text>

<Text>I stayed at the Place Hotel for a recent business trip. If you work in the Financial district, the hotel is a great location for you. It is an easy walk from the hotel to anywhere in that district. I work at the Salesforce Tower, and it was about a half mile walk.

The Hotel  lobby is beautiful, and the room comfortable, clean, and quiet (as requested). 

This is the third hotel I stayed in for recent travel to San Francisco, and I like this one the best by far.<//Text>< Pictures>

< Text>
Took my wife to The Palace for her 50th birthday weekend. Wonderful atmosphere that fits a special occasion. The service is top notch: friendly, helpful, and welcoming. The property is well-maintained and clean. Had tea at the GC Lounge, which was perfect for the occasion, and dinner at the Pied Piper, which was cozy. Loved the Fitness Center and the proximity to all things downtown. The only shortcomings were street noise in our streetside room and lack of a coffee maker to heat up water.<//Text>

<Name>Kristi Clark<//Name><Time>1545193972184</Time><Text>Luxury hotel in all respects, one of the few that has modernized (GREAT design in lobby, restaurants and rooms) while managing to retain the historic elegance of this grand hotel in San Francisco. We were there for business and pleasure, and this downtown hotel is close to many sights. We brought our dogs and the hotel was quite lovely about it very accommodating, but I do not advise bringing dogs because taking them outside, including within the same block, was a rather harrowing experience because of the many homeless, especially at night. Because there are no opportunities to eat inside the hotel with the dogs (such as outer edge of bar, etc., as many hotels are now affording), we ordered room service. It was SENSATIONAL!  Every morsel of every course was utterly delectable. The hotel is professionally and charmingly well staffed, and all services orchestrated without a hitch. The beds are heaven!  I would give 5 stars if we didn't have to be so nervous about walking in the area because of the many suffering and drugged out homeless, and if the hotel offered a dog friendly area to enjoy its wonderful food. All around, though, it was a 5 star experience!</Text><user_id>104388866490678657687<//user_id><Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id><Response>None<//Response>< pictures>

< text>
-Three rooms in the course of two night stay due to issues with the rooms. 
-Food quality-Sub-par
-Food service- Non-existent
-Internet Service-Poor 
The best part of my stay was checking out. The entire staff needs training on communication and engagement. This is a reactive environment rather a proactive environment and it shows. This is the first hotel stay I have experienced with Marriott where I had to assert myself, not as an Ambassador Elite, but as a person in order to have issues addressed and demand respect. While the hotel may have historic merit, the staff and the room quality leave much to be desired.<//text>

< Review>
Beautiful hotel and great location! Service was top notch, facility exceptional, food amazing! Really no complaints about the entire stay. It definitely feels like a luxury hotel and the main room is beautiful! One of the nicest I have ever seen. Only recommendation is that the airport shuttle left something to be desired. Although a great price point - I would have been willing to pay a little extra to be transported in a nicer passenger van that was organized by the hotel. Left something to be desired about the E2E customer experience at a luxury hotel. Overall, definitely a repeat next time I am in San Fran!<//Review>

<Rate>1<//Rate>< text>
Very rude and hostile Doorman. I was staying in the hotel from in December of 2018.  During check out, I parked my car in front of the hotel so that I could bring my luggage from upstairs.   The doorman (his name is Norman) warned me with a very rude attitude that I could not park my car in front of the hotel for more than 10 minutes.  I tried to explain him that I was a hotel guest and going to bring my family and luggage as soon as I could.  He did not allow me to even finish my sentence, interrupted me while I was talking, and pointed finger at me while he was talking.  He again told me "10 minutes! and after that you will get a ticket" .  I stayed in many hotels in my life, and I know that in the hotel loading/check in area the police never gives ticket.  also it is the doorman/valet staffs responsibility to assist guests with loading/unloading the car.  He was not helping at all, instead was very rude, hostile,.before I was leaving I asked his name, he again with a very 'authoritative' tone replied "Norman the doorman' and did not even look at me.  Extremely disappointing and unexpected from a luxury hotel staff.  I experienced better trained, and far better mannered employees in motels.
It is a shame that such a beautiful hotel has such ugly attitude employees.<//text>

< review>
It's been quite a few years since my last stay at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco but I'll be back. Rooms have been 
nicely refurbished; room darkening drapes, comfy bed, beautifully clean, convenient fridge. Great gym which was
clean and well tended by Lydia, beautiful buffet breakfast (the fruit!) and helpful/friendly staff everywhere (as I was 
slightly struggling to get out of my room with my luggage a passing engineer, on a service call to a nearby room, asked
if I needed any help ...). 
Special thanks to Jelly at the front desk. So helpful at check-in and check out (she found a discrepancy on my bill 
and removed the charge).<//review>

< text>
stayed for 5 days 4 Nights in Palace Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here.

This used to be one of the tallest buildings in San Fransisco in the late 19th Century. Now, Palace hotel is one of the most luxurious hotels in SF.

I love the architecture. It's classic, classy, cozy and clean. The Lobby lounge looks stunning. The Room is spacious. Love firm matrass and the soft pillow.

The service is excellent. I still remember when I was sitting on one of the couches, one of the hotel staffs offered me bottle waters and Girardelli Chocolate with warm greeting and smile. Loved it.

Location wise, it's only 5 minutes walk to Union Square where all hign end boutiques located. If you are a big fans of chocolate and ice cream, The SF legendary Ghirardelly Chocolate & Ice Cream is located at one of its corner on the ground floor.

Will surely recommend this hotel to my fellow Indonesian tour leaders, travel agencies & business partners.< /text>

<resp>None</resp><review>First and worst, they lied to me. Wedding anniversary, wife born/raised in the city. Check in, you get a standard room, sir, 300 square, zero upgrades available. Closet of a room, cupboard of a bathroom with one of the three worst showers I've ever had in my life. A stale cake for the anniversary celebration, safe and telephone don't work. Shown an alternate room, even smaller, bathroom impossibly smaller than the first, but you get a fancy Toto toilet seat. See end.

This - a Luxury Collection Hotel.

Hotel does not have any sort of a dinner restaurant, just at the bar in the Pied Piper (see separate review of that).

There is a magnificent stained glass ceiling in the court, breakfast and some drinks (bartender here single bright spot of the hotel). Lovely public room, but you can just walk in from another hotel to enjoy.

< review>
The Palace Hotel is that rare old world hotel that has been impeccably updated with luxurious details without sacrificing the soul and tradition of the property. I especially loved the Frette linens and Byredo toiletries in room. Room service was decadent and delicious. Room was impeccably clean and quiet, perfect for my business travel reason for staying. 
I would have loved to have some means to boil water in the room in the am so I could make tea without having to travel to the lobby, but otherwise, I will be staying at the Palace again!< /review>

< review>
I gave this hotel a second chance after waking up to jackhammering the last stay with no previous warning that there would be construction.  There was construction this time also, however, we were moved to a "quiet room".  A room with no space to move in, no completed closet to hang clothing for 2 people, no chest of drawers for clothing, no counter space on the bathroom vanity, no proper drainage for showering, no shower door to avoid water getting all over the small bathroom floor.  2 people cannot fit in the bathroom at all, in fact it is smaller than a department store stahl in the public bathrooms.  The electrical outlet came out with the hairdryer plug.  Tv went out the second day in the second room they transferred us too.  Housekeeping didn't clean the room until we called and then we waited for an hour to get a towel at 3:30 p.m.  We also asked for 2 bars of soap because once the bar of soap went into the shower it was impossible to grab it without getting into the shower because of the design of the doorless shower.  In fact, turning on the shower was another project in itself on top of the water stoppage.   One apology from the manager which I insisted to talk to.  The lobby and restaurants are beautiful as the Palace always was... however, the recent year's renovations to the rooms make absolutely no sense to the "luxury" theme.  We were there for 4 functions and tried to rest in between and with the on and off-air conditioning units which there was no way to turn off, it was enough for us to call it quits on the hotel.  When we spoke of it to others that were attending the events there, they agreed they will be staying elsewhere.  Very disappointed.<//review>

<Pictures>None</Pictures><text>The Palace is one of the grand ladies of a bygone era. You are transported back in time to experience a world of privilege and elegance. A living institution of majesty. It's regrettable the guest room corridors and the guest room themselves are so poorly and cheaply designed. It truly shows such disrespect for this truly magnificent hotel. The Garden Court is one of the most impressive interiors you'll ever experience, but unfortunately the furnishings and carpet are absolutely dreadful. Marriott has some of the finest hotels in the world and knows perfectly well how to design great hotels. They should be ashamed of what they've done to this incredible property.<//text><user>None< /user>< Response>

<Review>This hotel is quite grand.  The guest rooms are spacious and exceptionally clean, and the daily cleaning service makes sure they stay that way.  There are a number of extras that make your stay special including robes, slippers, waterfall showerhead, heated toilet seats, etc.  Also, the bathroom has enough space for all of your toiletries.  Wonderful hotel and very close to tons of things to do.  It is within walking distance of the wharf, and you can rent bikes nearby to ride across the Golden Gate Bridge.  Even the public transportation is within a block which you can easily take to Oakland or to Haight/Ashbury.  The concierge will tell you which line to get on.  We had no issues getting around without a car and always felt safe doing so.< /Review>< Date>

<Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb< /Gmap_id><user_id>None</user_id><rating>None</rating><date>1541721600000<//date>< Review>
My wife and I stay exclusively at The Palace Hotel whenever in San Francisco, whether for business (me) or pleasure (she and I), for the luxury, location,and royal treatment provided by this wonderful hotel.  We were aware of the labor strike prior to our arrival, yet decided to stay anyway, knowing that The Palace staff would do everything that they could to make guests feel comfortable and accommodated. We made the right choice.


  


Although the staff was undoubtedly under stress due to the strike, everyone we were in contact with was cheerful, helpful, and went out of their wayto make our stay a typical stay at The Palace: excellent.  The property was up to its usual standards for cleanliness, and the staff for their professionalism. 


  


My wife left a sentimental keepsake, valuable only to her, in the room by mistake, and the Security and housekeeping staff went out of their way tofind and return the item to her.


  


We will continue to frequent The Palace Hotel as our home away from home while in San Francisco.< /Review>

<Time>1521664238244<//Time>< text>
I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel. Wow!! The rooms were luxurious and the hotel itself was beautiful. The location is perfect. Many great restaurants within walking distance and easy location to get around.
What really stood out for me though, was the amazing staff. They were so courteous and helpful. A special thank you to Jenny Lee. She greeted us when we checked in. We mentioned that we came to San Francisco to celebrate my birthday. When we came to our room for the evening there was a bottle of champagne on ice with the kindest note from her. That was truly amazing and so thoughtful.
Thank you to all the staff at the Palace hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco!< /text>

<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< text>
Up until today, I've always had a great experience at The Palace in San Francisco. Today though, I called to request a credit card authorization form, as I have booked a room here for a co-worker, but needed to put the expense on my credit card. After speaking with two individuals at the hotel, I was told emphatically that the policy was that you must request a credit card authorization 72 hours in advance. I was told over and over that this was a policy of the hotel, with no real reasoning behind it. As a Platinum Elite Marriott Bonvoy member, I would highly recommend that the Marriott team review their policies and procedures, and take into account how these policies affect the business traveler staying at their hotels. As someone who books hotels last minute for work, 99% of the time, sending a credit card authorization form 72 hours in advance is not even a possibility. Now, I'm forced to make the choice if I can even keep this reservation, or go to another hotel that can accommodate my needs.< /text>

I stayed at the Palace due to its proximity to the start location of the SF Half Marathon. Also, it is one of a handful of downtown SF hotels with a swimming pool and jacuzzi. It‚Äôs a short 15 minute walk to the Ferry Building and SF Playhouse. 

The electric socket in the bathroom wasn‚Äôt working so I had to dry and curl my hair in the desk area and I slightly burned my finger as I didn‚Äôt have a mirror. Also, I heard other guests talking outside my room, so it‚Äôs not as soundproof as I‚Äôd prefer. <Time>1556928000000</Time><user_name>MissingSPGElite< /user_name>< Text>
I've stayed at the Palace multiple times in my lifetime on most of my stays in San Francisco.  I'm always eager to return.  On the few times I've chosen to stay elsewhere just for variety, I'm still back at least one morning for breakfast at the Palm Court.  The experience of enjoying a meal in this special place can't be duplicated.   The atmosphere is outstanding.  I've been coming since I was a teen and I continue to be excited to be back.  The Pied Piper is also a favorite SF bar spot.    Rooms are always spacious and comfortable.  There is nothing not to like about this great hotel that's been a part of San Francisco heritage for over 100 years.< /Text>

<pictures>None< /pictures></record></dataset><record>
<pics>None</pics><review>Stayed here just before christmas for one night. SPG recognition was great - free suite upgrades and automatic late checkout. Front desk staff (Casey) were great on check-in and really made us feel welcome. Rooms are fantastic - best I've stayed in with SPG. My only issue comes with the bar, both facilities and staff. For such a luxurious hotel, the bar was fairly average and could definitely have been better. This issue was compounded by staff who were not especially attentive or seeking to help. In fact, we were informed at 11:30pm that it was last call for the bar (apparently standard practice, though this seems very early for a city center hotel). Hearing this, we took a moment to decide on our drinks and headed to the bar, only to be told that choices were limited to beer and wine (with 25 minutes still to serve?!). No apologies from the bartender, just the impression that we the guests were standing between him and the end of his shift. 
Would I stay there again? Yes, absolutely. Would I choose to visit the bar again? No.< /review>< resp>

< text>
My family and I stayed over a weekend night as part of a holiday staycation and are already looking forward to returning. 

The public spaces were decorated gorgeously, my daughter loved getting offered chocolates at check-in, and we loved the generous suite upgrade.

The Palace hotel is a classic, timeless SF institution, and it remains so under Marriott's stewardship.  The Garden Court restaurant and Pied Piper lounge are both unique and highly recommended. < text>
If cities are themselves museums, then staying in an historic hotel adds tremendously to the visit. The Palace is stunning in design, in preservation, in upkeep. no detail of the building should be missed, and the location is outstanding. seems strange in 2018 that there was no in-room wifi, and i was not happy to hear from my airport shuttle driver that i should have been provided a pass for a free ($17) ride to the airport. but i still highly recommend this place, especially if you will have time for r & r, because the gathering spaces are remarkable !< /text>

< Name>
JSaint<//Name>
< text>
I stay at the Palace when traveling on business frequently. Often enough in fact that many of the front desk staff remember me we I check in or out. That is such a rarity and is truly appreciated particularly for such a large hotel. On one of my recent visits while checking in, I casually mentioned to Jerry at the front desk that I was coming back for a personal trip that it happened to be my birthday. When I was checking in for that stay, I was blown away by the royal treatment. The manager, Nina, personally greeted me and my wife. They upgraded my room and even had a few nice gifts waiting for me. It was already one of my favorite places to stay in SF and this gesture simply put it in a league of its own. Thank you!<//text>

< Text>
The palace hotel is a beautiful hotel and is located centrally close to Union Square. China town is an easy walk away and it is about 30 minutes walk to the wharf area. The rooms are well appointed and there is a great indoor pool, spa and gym that can be used year round. The staff were also very nice. When we arrived on Christmas eve there was quite a line to check in but staff handed out free water and chocolates and were kind enough to even provide free wifi for our stay due to the wait. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting San Fran.<//Text>

<UserId.>None< /UserId.><review>Mostly a comfortable stay. The staff was all very nice but there is a major disconnect in terms of communication from front desk to housekeeping staff. At check in I was honored a 2 pm check out due to my SPG Gold status and was noted on my account. The day of check out I had 2 housekeepers knock on the door despite a do not disturb sign. I had already told the first housekeeper I had a 2 pm check out. The second one just barged on in.
It is pointless to offer a late check out benefit when you cannot relax due to the constant question: When are you leaving ?
I can see if I had requested this as a last minute benefit but it was noted at check in. 
On top of that the housekeeping staff is extremely loud talking to each other in the hallways and banging doors early in the morning. I ended leaving well before my requested check out time.

< Review>
My husband attending a conference.  We went to breakfast and only had 1 key between us. I tried to get one at the desk. Refused because I didn't have picture ID, and my passport on my phone was not sufficient. I was bullied by the person at reception, had to wait 15 minutes for a security person to accompany me to my room, who then tried to push his way into the room, and jammed his foot against the door so I couldn't close it while I got my ID to show him. Took him another 5 minutes to relay to someone my name & DL # to someone.  I have NEVER been treated like a criminal because I didn't have a key, and I have travelled extensively, and stayed very often in way better hotels than this one. In other places I have always been treated with respect. I would never stay here again, and will likely just avoid Marriots in the future based on principle. I understand security. I don't understand rudeness, disrespect, bullying, and intimidation.<//Review>

<Rating>4< /Rating>< Text>
Outstanding central location. Beautiful Garden Court restaurant for breakfast and tea is a stunning architectural gem. Very elegant and traditional. Good gym. Good pool and hot tub although pool, advertised as heated, is very cold and hot tub/Jacuzzi could have been warmer too. Public areas nice but aside from Garden Court not remarkable. Was in a superior suite. Pleasant and good quality furnishings but again nothing that stands out in terms of design. Closet in slightly awkward place by door but spacious bathroom with good storage, counter space. No upgrade available as a platinum premier elite in the rewards programme. I stayed during the union strike and temporary staff and managers were handling all the services so service was imperfect at best. Coffees and shower caps not refilled etc.  No room service and bar/restaurant had only one salad and one burger due to limited staff (however they were good and the breakfast buffet was very nice). The Marriott Marquis, where my family stayed, managed to provide better service despite being strike impacted. The website said they were operating normally. Had I known services were so curtailed I would have stayed elsewhere so they lose a star for service failures and failure to notify. But the staff that were here were friendly and helpful and kind and go out of their way for you. Might well be a 5 star experience without a strike (but if you like swimming, don't expect good water temperatures).<//Text>

<Text>As someone who travels a lot for work and pleasure, there is a certain standard you come to expect, especially at a luxury hotel. < userid>

< username>
loboexp<//username>
<Time>1342742400000<//Time><Rate>None</Rate>< Text>
It is a beautiful historic, well maintained hotel in a great central location. Restaurant is absolutely breathtaking. We were there for 4 nights, and didn't use a whole lot of the amenities, but we did appreciate our room being cleaned promptly every morning along with never having to make a call to housekeeping for something they forget. Excellent Service. We ate breakfast every morning at the buffet. There was more than enough good choices , but for me eating only oatmeal and fruit, $32 is a little pricey. The bar seemed to always have people in it. Again, it was classy and the painting above the bar breathtaking. Good place to hang after dark, since it's too freaken cold in San Francisco to do anything at night without a winter coat. That was the only downside to the entire trip. I loved the hotel, and am glad I stayed there. If I ever had to go back to San Fran, I would stay again. (Let's hope I don't)!<//Text>

<userid>None</userid><name>RealScully</name><time>1516492800000<//time><rating>None</rating><Review>Whenever we travel to The City, our preference is for The Palace. Based on our several trips there, our stay is always great; from the check in to the rooms and everything in between. Very comfortable beds and helpful staff.

Our food and beverage experience continues to be sub-par, however. We have had several breakfasts in The Garden Court and do not order the buffet. We are often left seeking out staff to fill our water, take our order, bring our check, etc. Bar service is also very slow. If you need to get somewhere quickly, I would eat breakfast elsewhere.

We love the Pied Piper's ambiance, but the service here is also less than I would expect for a hotel of this caliber. Often difficult to get the staff's attention, whether we are at the bar or seated for a casual meal. Once our server went on break and we had no one check on us until he got back, so we had to get our own drinks. Got the overall sense that the staff was just waiting for the clock to tick down so they could go home. I will go here again, but it will be for Maxfield Parrish, not the service.<//Review><Pics>None< /Pics><Resp>None</Resp>< GmapID>

< review>
This is a gorgeous old hotel that I have frequented for years. It is truly grand. But, this time I was made to feel like a second class citizen. It seems something has changed. I have stayed here a great deal and even enjoyed the high tea during Christmas. Usually they give me a very generous upgrade to a larger room . Its not comfortable - its small - no coffee maker, you can hear the city, and the tv is at an angle that you have to crane your head to see. I called to ask for a bigger room and was told that SPG folks dont get those rooms. This isnt true - I have stayed in the penthouse here before. Truly sad. < review>
The Palace Hotel was build before 1906 San Francisco earthquake. This an amazing classical building. The soaring ceilings in public area and hotel rooms create feeling of spacious freedom.r44
Lobby is decorated with beutiful flowers.h
The pool is indoors and a great place to relax, swim, and lounge. Nice hot tub.

The matress and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom had a tub.

We enjoyed breakfast in the breathtakingly beutiful dining room. The poppy seed lemon waffles were delightful.

Overnight valley parking is available for $72.

What I found disappointing was service. We arrived and one ballet was busy while another one was on his cell phone and  We came into a lobby and were greeted a by a long and slow check in line. It took a long time for management to add another person. The staff greeted us without an enthusiasm or simple smile. The same in the dining room and everywhere else. I wonder if staff is underpaid or there is some sort of dispute going on.

Honestly, I had better and more welcoming service in Sacramento Holiday Inn.</review>

<UserId.>None</UserId.><user_name>smithmga</user_name>< date>

<Rating>None<//Rating><review>We researched various hotels in San Francisco and chose The Palace. The location was perfect for our needs. Restaurants, museums, China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, Westfield Mall, etc., are all near or a short bus or taxi ride away. The hotel has a gorgeous area for drinks and dining. We took several pictures and enjoyed two breakfasts, after dinner snacks, and three evening cocktails during our week stay. The hotel manager, Sara S., went out of her way to accommodate us after security had to deal with an unruly guest in an adjacent room. Recommend asking for an interior room due to street noise. The final evening, someone set off a car alarm outside our window at 3:40 AM and after a minute the beeping stopped but then started again for another 20 seconds. The air conditioning was perfect and was needed since we hit a record high (106 degrees on Friday, 1 Sep). The room was clean and nice and the bed was comfortable. The shuttle returning us to the airport was quick (16 minutes). The concierges were very nice and helpful. Our daughter was pleased we came to visit and we will choose The Palace if we return before she returns to Georgia.< /review><pictures>None<//pictures>< resp>
None< /resp>
