<Resp>None</Resp><Text>I stayed my 728, 729, and 730th night at a starwood property at this "luxury collection" Palace Hotel in San Francisco . The check in agent thanked me profusely for my loyalty (lifetime Platinum status) and then told me I was upgraded and checked me into a room on the 3rd floor, next to the elevator banks, sharing a wall with the service elevator, overlooking interior rooms and a cracked glass dome of the lobby. Ironically, there was a book in the room heralding the great views at Luxury Collections hotel, which was a great relief since I had the worst view I've had in a hotel room all year and at least I could look at the book to see what views I should have got as one of the most loyal and valuable customer who has spent over a quarter million dollars at starwood properties. I dropped a quick note to @spgassist and I got a call from a manager. First, I was informed that I indeed had an upgrade since i had a larger bathroom (quick customer service tip: being told you have been upgraded from unacceptable to tolerable doesn't make things better). Also, they could move me to an exterior room (so why did they not give me this in the first place?), which I really did not have the time to do since I had unpacked. Would I like a bottle of wine or "something"? No - I do not drink wine and even if I did I don't think a $15 bottle of wine comes anywhere close to addressing my issues over a very expensive room. I wondered if anyone would make any further efforts to make amends during my remaining stay. No one did.

Here's my problem: this is the Luxury Collection and not a mid-level hotel. The minimum level of acceptable service is exceptional service at comparable competitive hotels. Their regular customers receive world class service. Imagine a customer who had spent over 700 nights with the group! If I were a manager looking at this, I would want to know why this room had been assigned to a Starwood Lifetime Platinum. Was it indifference, incompetence, or a systematic bias in how rooms are allocated? 

I do not recommend the hotel at all. If this is how they treat their most loyal and valuable customers, I can only imagine what it must be like for the infrequent traveler. I am considering cancelling about 5 reservations I have at SPG properties through mid-january based on how poor my experience has been. I will not be staying here when I return to San Francisco at the end of December.<//Text><gmapID>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//gmapID>< name>
Gl0betrotter</name>

< Review>
We couldn't have asked for a lovelier stay:
Our room was not only comfortable but beautifully appointed as well. Very clean. Excellent staff:
Bill, quite possibly the nicest man in the city, is friendly and courteous as he helps with our bags. (A wealth of S.F. information!) Lydia, at the pool, is always at the ready with an apple, bottle of water or plastic bag for my wet suit - God bless her, she even remembers my name and other details about me!
Do yourself a favor and stay at the Palace.</Review>

This is a very historical place. The location is perfect. It's right by Market St and located near the Montgomery Street Bart station, so getting there is easy. <Rating>5< /Rating><Time>1515268597852< /Time>< Text>
I stayed at The Palace Hotel for 4 days.  The staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful!!  They made my daughters and I feel like royalty without seeming pretentious.  Doormen opened doors in perfectly pressed attire, yet would joke with you about anything if you wanted to and we‚Äôre always ready with directions.
Rooms were not spacious at all but ours had amazing shower and comfortable bed.
The main thing is that the lobby is the most beautiful space I have ever seen (and I have stayed in a lot of high end hotels).  The ceiling is made of glass.  The sitting area is full of leather chairs and palm trees.  More beautiful than I can describe.< /Text>

< rating>
None<//rating>
< Text>
The Palace Hotel is absolutely beautiful. The exquisite architecture with detailed stained glass domed ceilings and beautiful marble columns and floors throughout, makes this hotel really breath-taking. There is a lot of history behind this hotel and it has been preserved quite well.

The swimming pool was a major selling point for us staying at this hotel. It too, has a glass-domed ceiling. How peaceful and relaxing!

The only thing I could find that this hotel is missing was, there were no dresser drawers to put your clothes in. All in all, just a minor detail.

I would highly recommend this hotel for any occasion. The location is ideal and the staff is great as well.< /Text>

<user_name>Fryguy</user_name>< text>
Every time I walk into this hotel I feel like I have stepped back in time to the early 1900's (in a good way, not a worn out hotel way)! They recently completed a complete renovation and The Palace is now spectacular. I loved loved loved my room. Received a nice Platinum upgrade to a junior suite which was very nice. Plenty of room to stretch out and get work done as well as some more exercises. 

My absolute favorite thing at this hotel is the morning breakfast buffet in the Garden Court. The setting is incredible and the food is excellent. I am disappointed in their lunchtime offerings but the breakfast is unbeatable. The Pied Piper bar is also an excellent place to have a drink and take a meeting or two. 

I highly recommend this hotel.</text>

<Text>While I loved this hotel and the location was great, there were a few things that may prohibit me from staying at this hotel again. For one, there is no coffee maker in the room. So in order to have my morning coffee, I had to pay $20 for a cup to be delivered to my room. While the rooms were clean and fairly updated, there was a lot of ticking and crackling throughout the night. It was impossible to sleep. Food was average (room service) - nothing to rave about. The staff was friendly, quick to respond, and easy to deal with. The day we left, it took 30mins for valet to get our car. Frustrating departure. Overall, great hotel - just not a perfect experience.< /Text>< userid>

- esp in-room dining staff are unbelievably rude. they cut you off when you are talking, force their scrip on you when you already gave them the info, and have a sassy attitude saying "that is what I just said" when you try to confirm your order. This has been encountered more than 3-4 times

- the lobby and entrance is truly a charm 

+ room is dark and dim with a very uncomfortable desk 

wouldnt have stayed here for 4 weeks if it werent for the spg points<//Review>< user_id>

< Text>
The hotel is a luxury hotel by all definitions -- this is evident upon arrival and confirmed upon staying more than 5 minutes in the building. However, what makes this hotel truly stand out is the attentiveness of staff. They went far and beyond the usual to accommodate me -- and I didn't think I had any special requests. The staff were hugely helpful when I needed to change rooms due to noisy families in my corridor -- the desk staff, Arturo, even came up to help me when the bell staff were busy. The servers, the bell service, the doormen -- all were fantastic: friendly, helpful, and sincerely wanting my stay to be memorable and smooth. I commend them for this -- thank you. It was a most wonderful stay.</Text>

<Rating>None< /Rating>< Review>
I came back a second time for a longer stay and the excitement kinda wane and the place doesn't really feel 4-star anymore. The place is still great for its location but there were a few mishaps this time. 

1. My first room has a Japanese style bidet toilet! 
2. The room has a switch by the door that does nothing. I think there was suppose to be a floor lamp (in my new room, the switch controls a floor lamp). 
2. There was also a used towel and robe >__<. I didn't found out till I came back late at night so didn't want to deal with it until morning. The desk in the room was also extremely dusty. Dirty towel and dusty desk makes me think no one has clean the place in a while.
3. When I went down to tell front desk in the morning, they offered to upgrade me to a different room. I had to head out so didn't get to see what they gave me. When I got back, I found that my upgrade room is now 2 floors lower. It is for sure bigger but not an upgrade for me. I am sensitive to noise and have specifically stated in my profile that I would like higher floor room to avoid street noise. This was also a connected room so even more noise. 
4. The toiletry is a big negative for me. There are lots of variety and great, but the shampoo, body wash, and lotion smells too much like perfume, a bit overpowering. 
5. Front desk seems a bit dismissive once you have check out. When I ask to leave luggage, they just point me to the Bell Desk on the far end, but there wasn't anyone at the Bell Desk at the time. 

----------------------------------
Previous stay was only for 1 night so didn't really experience the hotel more thoroughly.

A true 4-star hotel. Room is nice and staff are friendly.

Hotel is in a good location near transit and lots of food options.

1) Bini's kitchen: Nepalese dumpling aka momo
2) Asha's Tea house: good tea options 
3) Mazarine Coffee
4) Super Duper burger: cheddar garlic fries<//Review>

< review>
Came to the Palace for two nights of our honeymoon and the staff was exceptional. We were upgraded to a larger room and we had a 'congratulations' miniature cake waiting in our room. The rooms were very quiet and we never heard other guests through the walls. The hotel concierge arranged our dinner reservations in little Italy and we were in and out of the busiest restaurants within an hour. Overall this is an excellent place to stay.</review>

<Rating>None<//Rating>< text>
Dear Palace Hotel,
We love the place and it shows as we book you more than any other hotel. Typically when we arrive we are immediately offered an upgrade based on our status and also informed about the possibility of late checkout. Janet did not mention either of these, and when I asked about them she seemed quite reluctant to make an offer. However, she did say that if I wanted to upgrade the room I would have to wait till 4pm. We looked at the room (which seemed smaller than the one we booked) and asked to have the new room. To our surprise, it was ready immediately. Which meant it had been ready all along, she had just hoped that we would not take the room. I am sure she is a capable staff member, but Janet needs to recognize that the personal service of a 5* hotel is what we SPG status members expect when staying. No one at The Palace had ever been so nonchalant about our arrival before. I hope they will not again.<//text>

<rate>None< /rate><Name>Orbitz reviewer</Name><user_id>None< /user_id></record></dataset><record>
<userid>117458148518370467630</userid><Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id><Rating>5< /Rating><time>1571770991281</time><user_name>Alex D<//user_name>< text>
Highly recommended hotel.  Beautiful lobby which is always welcoming when you're staying in a new place. Quality bar and food on-site.This is convenient if you just want to go downstairs or order in to your room.

Cleaning service was excellent as the rooms were spotless. They did a great job of turning over the room when we were away. Never had to call down because it was missed. Complimentary newspapers and shoes polish services were welcome. If we did need anyting service was usually very prompt.

Indoor pool and hot tub is a huge Plus. The gym also looks adequate for traveling needs.

Beds seemed stiff at first but ended up being one of the more comfortable mattresses we've experienced throughout our travels. Keep in mind we're very picky Tempur-Pedic users.

Plenty of amenities provided. Sheets and towels were of high quality.

They were even nice enough to provide some complimentary treats for a celebration.

Overall met expectations given price point.</text>

<userid>None</userid><username>STARFLEET</username>< Date>

< rate>
None</rate>
< text>
As my wife and I were enjoying the lovely buffet breakfast in the resplendent Garden Court at the Palace Hotel, we were each reminded of our favorite hotels in Rome or Vienna... How nice to find such a wonderful hotel in San Francisco!

We were delighted at the Platinum recognition...it has made our stay so very comfortable and elegant! As an architect, it is a treat to visit The Palace, and although we didn't see any of the refreshed rooms, our classically-detailed corner room overlooking Market Street was perfect for our family weekend in San Francisco.

Additionally, I have to say that the staff was universally friendly, solicitous, helpful and caring in a way that clearly goes beyond practiced professionalism...kudos!

The location is perfect and we we were able to walk everywhere: from Chinatown to the cable cars to the immediate neighborhood's high end shopping and restaurants. We also enjoyed dining at the Pied Piper grille (try the lamb shank shepherd's pie.)

We look forward to our next residency at the Palace!<//text>

<rate>4<//rate><pictures>None<//pictures><name>Jocelyn Le Conte< /name>< text>
Beautiful historic hotel, with pleasantly decorated rooms. Very clean with excellent service. The bathroom is rather on the small side and contains the only mirrors in the room, so it takes a while for two people to get ready. We had a Market Street view and enjoyed the large windows. This proved a bit noisy at night time with the cable cars and people shouting in the street but settled down after a while. Breakfast under the glass ceiling is a real treat, but we found the restaurant closed rather early for lunch so ate that elsewhere. The food is overpriced for what you get, but the hotel is in a great location for other restaurants.<//text>

< Text>
Though the hotel was a beautiful place to stay and located very well. I was there for a conference and the billing was a real headache....we got the room before the actual conference registration was open and was assured that we would get the conference rate. A few days before the conference when we called to check on the amount we were told that we needed to go directly through the conference website, yet no one every let us know so no rooms were available by then. When checking out of the hotel Jim had to put it on his personal credit card because the hotel said they never got a cc authorization, yet the authorization was sent almost 2 month prior! Good thing he had a credit card, I am so embarrassed to have put him at this hotel and will be buying a nice bottle of wine to ask for forgiveness!!<//Text>

<date>1570060800000</date><Rating>None< /Rating><Review>This hotel is like a gate into the rich San Francisco history, while up to date in terms services.</Review><gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb</gmap_id>< username>

< Pictures>

<userid>None</userid><username>JXBZ<//username><Time>1478131200000</Time><Rate>None<//Rate>< review>
Full Disclosure: I am an SPG Platinum and was able to use some Suite Nite Awards for an upgrade to a suite on my stay. This of course impacted some of my view of this property.

This is a stunningly beautiful hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. The beauty does not only extend to the lobby, but also the staircases and hallways throughout the property. My room was well appointed, and as a suite, had a living room with couch and multiple comfortable chairs.

While the property maintains its history in beautiful fashion, the HVAC system and bathroom fixtures are very modern. No issues with having the ability to control the temperatures, and no plumbing issues with scalding or freezing water.

I took advantage of the complimentary overnight shoe shine service and had my freshly polished shoes back at 7:00am, in plenty of time to start my day.

The staff that I interacted with at reception, restaurant, housekeeping, and turndown service were all professional and pleasant. 

I would consider this a true signature SPG property in San Francisco, and would recommend it without reservation.</review>

< Review>
A friend who grew up in SF recommended this hotel and I am so glad she did. The ambience was elegant and historical but it was extremely comfortable at the same time. Concierge staff was SO helpful - I loved all of their recommendations. The breakfast is pricey but I am so happy I tried it once for the experience - there are a wide range of options on the buffet. The hotel is near public transportation which was extremely helpful to get to UCSF and Golden Gate Park. It was a comfortable walk to Fisherman's Wharf. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone!</Review>

<username>Kevin< /username><Time>1559088000000</Time>< Rate>

<Text>The hotel itself is historically beautiful, the staff is extremely accommodating (particularly the housekeepers), and my stay was great overall. But the location and the thin walls/windows keeps me from giving this hotel a 5/5. I understand the homeless issue is a problem all over SF, but this specific area seemed excessive in particular. There were times we'd walk out of the hotel and it seemed homeless would completely surround the block around the hotel, and with the amount we paid to stay here, I would think this could at least be somewhat controlled. I realize now that SOMA (South of Market) is a particularly dense area for homeless, but for those who don't know beforehand it should be known it is not an exaggeration and might be one of the worst in the city. Only other issue was the thin walls/windows. From your room, you can hear a majority of the noise and conversation in rooms adjacent to yours, you can hear everything going on in the hallways, and you can hear everything outside in the streets below regardless of the floor you're on (we stayed on the 8th of 9 floors).< /Text>< Pics>
None< /Pics>

< text>
The Palace is a beautiful hotel, but that is the only attribute of the property. As someone who stays at many luxury hotels (SPG and others), I can say the service level at The Palace is among the worst I have experienced. Simply put, its wildly apathetic and always rooted in how they can't help you. Starting from before we even arrived at the hotel, I put several calls into both the concierge and front desk to get recommendations for wine tasting and secure reservations for my anniversary. Neither returned any phone calls. As a result of no one ever calling me back from the front desk, my early check-in was not on record and the front desk clerk told me I would not have access to my room until 6pm. While I understand, early check-ins can't always be met, I do expect my room to be ready at the correct time. At which point, the desk agent told me I could have lunch in your lobby. Of course, the lobby actually doesn't serve lunch after 2pm.. but why would your front desk person know these things. At which point, I tweeted starwood a complaint as I have a large twitter following. Once this happened, finally your on duty manager from your property actually called me back. The fact that I had to use social media to even connect with someone at your hotel says volumes. Once we finally got into the room, little things are just off. The mini-bar was never re-stocked, the walls were all scuffed up with black marks. Anytime, we had any questions for bell service or concierge, everyone seemed very bothered and offered very little help. Additionally, my partners name was never added to the room by your staff and he was left stranded for an hour with no access to the room. Overall, it put a very bad taste in my mouth and took a lot of fun out of my anniversary weekend. To add insult to injury, the bottle of champagne they sent up as a gift was actually charged to my card and still hasn't been taken off< /text>

<review>I recently stayed at The Palace Hotel with my fiance for a weekend getaway. The lobby and exterior of the hotel were excellent. When we entered our room the light switch did not turn on the lamp, which was not a big deal however, we were excited to see our room for the first time. We then had to shuffle our way through the dark to find the light switch. Also, there were many markings on the wall that should have been painted over or cleaned. The trash can and tv console were noticeably chipped and needed to be replaced. In addition, under the glass on the nightstand was extremely dusty. Don't add glass if it cannot be maintained properly. I was disappointed primarily because the rest of the hotel was extravagant. I assumed that the rooms weren't as important or either I should have paid more for a better suite (which should not have been the case). I can say the bathroom was the best part of our stay. It was beautiful. The staff was also excellent.< /review><rate>None<//rate>< pictures>

< text>
Arriving in the lobby after a very delayed flight, I had high expectations for the room. With my SPG gold status, I was ‚Äúupgraded‚Äùto a deluxe room. When I arrived in the room, it was clear the rug had not been vacuumed-food scraps were next to the bed-YUCK! I called the front desk, which sent housekeeping instead of just switching me.

The next morning I opened the curtains to look directly over at another side of the hotel!This is deluxe!!???? I visited the front desk to inquire about a room with at least a bit of sunlight. Apparently this hotel believes sunshine is a premium amenity-but I was moved. Be careful to request sunshine in your reservation request if you don‚Äôt want to look at a brick monolith outside of your window!

Beds are marginally comfortable-but definitely not as good as other 5* hotels I have stayed in.

On a positive note, in addition to the gorgeous public spaces, the staff, concierge, and housekeeping were fantastic!<//text>

<user_id>None<//user_id>< user_name>
supatight80<//user_name>
<date>1338422400000< /date>< rate>
None<//rate>
< review>
I simply love this hotel, very grand and the rooms were and always have been lovely.

First off, please do NOT DEMAND to be upgraded to a suite for being a platinum member. Just kindly request for one upon check-in. I was originally ugraded to a grand deluxe (even my original booking was a classic room). Simply and politely requested for a suite, and they happily upgraded me to a superior suite.

I have never stayed in a non-suite room so I cannot comment on what it looks like. But once again, I always pay the cheapest rate/room and have been upgraded to suite everytime I stay at the Palace Hotel - The suites are indeed posh.

However, I do have to agree with other reviewers that the bathroom is quite old looking - that's the only negative part about the room.

A negative aspect to this hotel is that their business centre is a 3rd party facility and thus, requires you to swipe your credit card in their machine (for printing purposes, etc).

Other than that, lovely hotel, lovely staffs. Never stayed in a different starwood property in SF as my first time there (2008) was great. so why try something else right?

Guest of Room 798 (May 25-28)</review>

Matthew Lee<//user_name>
<time>1481175423845< /time>< rate>
4</rate>
< review>
I would give it 3.5, but rounded up to 4. The location is great, but the reason I won't stay here again is due to the noise, at least in the room where I stayed. Noise from the bell staff calling for taxis. Noise from the other rooms. Noise from the hall.

While there are great things about old buildings, I think the problems can outweigh the charm.

I think they've done a nice job freshening the rooms. I especially love the Grohe fixtures in the bathroom with the rain shower. Very tastefully done, but not my preferred type of design.

I think the best part of the hotel is the Garden Court, which is magnificent. The classic design and amazing ceiling makes you feel like you're in Europe.

The service is also quite excellent.

Overall, it's a very nice hotel, but the fatal flaw for me is the noise.</review>

< review>
This hotel is a gorgeous national treasure. The rooms and hallways truly feel like you are a guest of royalty in a palace, especially because of the very high ceilings. Rooms are spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel rooms could use some maintenance--the bathrooms seemed dated and not in their best shape and the furniture in the rooms, with the exception of the bed and beautiful lamps, could use replacement. The sound-proofing in the walls was rather poor. SPG recognition was non-existent until I pointed out my status, at which time the attitude changed. With some tweaks and refurbishments, this could be one of my favorite SPG hotels.< /review>

</dataset><record>
<Text>I stay at the Palace several times a year but was pleasantly surprised when I checked in. The lobby and entranced looked the same but as soon as I got off the elevator onto my floor I immediately noticed everything was new. The paint is a cool grey and the carpeting is modern and classy and all of the hallway lighting is new. As I opened the door to my room I was amazed that 99% of room was new, including the bathroom.

The d√©cor is updated, bed, fixtures, carpeting, bathroom vanity and tile, shower, etc. I felt so comfortable and at home. Great job Palace! The only negatives were that the TV was on the very small (old) desk so there wasn't much room to work and it was very difficult to watch TV if you were also working at the desk. There are no outlets on top of the desk, only a power strip under the desk so hopefully all of your items have long cords. Although the bathroom was completely renovated, I was sad to see that a rainfall shower head was installed. I loved the showers here because of the high water pressure but now that has slowed to a rain (trickle).

Overall, I would recommend this hotel because of the vast improvements and look forward to seeing the rest of the public areas once they are complete.</Text>< Gmap_id>

< Review>
Planned a special weekend in SF for two couples, eager to be in a nice hotel with Platinum benefits. However, I was constantly having to return to front desk (and wait) for information or to correct simple things that should be seamless. Rooms were not ready at checkin. We were told (after pre-registering) to just come to the side of the desk to get our keys (and not stand in line). When we returned, I waited at the side for 15 minutes while all customers in line were served first (including two that arrived after I did - note to self, just get in line). Then only one room was ready, so it was not until 4 pm when we got to our room. We weren't given coupons for the Platinum Breakfast (not at checkin or when I returned to desk that night to inquire about how it works, times and place). When we arrived at restaurant, I had to return to the front desk and wait as the front desk reconfirmed my status and unsuccessfully looked for the notes that we had two platinum members so could invite 2 guests to breakfast. After 15 minutes, I could return to my guests in the restaurant lobby and go to breakfast. Our late check-out did not prevent our keys from being shut off at 1:30 pm, meaning I waited for 10-15 minutes outside of my room still wet from the pool as security came up to let me in. I was then told I needed to return to the front desk if I wanted new keys. We called down to ask for new keys to be brought up, but the front desk transferred us to security - no answer and sent to voicemail. We decided to give up and just check out. The breakfast buffet was of very good quality. However, please note that even with a breakfast coupon you will automatically receive a bill for a full buffet upcharge of $7/person plus tax and gratuity. The coupons indicate "complimentary continental breakfast" but there are no signs with prices, or indication as to what items (or sections are included or not included). Not a huge deal, but one guest didn't choose any hot items, so I was able to get the bill adjusted. A better system is needed.<//Review>

<rate>None</rate>< text>
We had the good fortune to stay at The Palace during two consecutive weeks -- it only got better. Both times we were upgraded to a lovely room; the second time Taka had ensured a great room for early check-in before we had arrived -- that's great service! Scott provided the perfect check-out.

We love the grand hallways, the solid construction and comfort of the rooms, and extraordinary staff. The pool and jacuzzi are a nice plus -- but it's time to have a true spa at a hotel of this caliber.

One quibble -- the cost for parking is $59 -- luckily we know local lots for half that but we missed the convenience of having our car taken care of for us. (I'm not sure if these astronomical fees are much different for other downtown SF hotels, however.) Just be aware if you go that route. Thank you for two fabulous stays.< /text>

<Response>None<//Response><review>Classic hotel. The lounge was beautiful. Rooms were clean and the facilities were top notch.</review><gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb< /gmap_id></record></dataset><record>
<userid>None< /userid>< user_name>
Mims<//user_name>
< time>
1324080000000< /time>
<rate>None<//rate>< review>
The Palace - A jewel sitting amongst a number of very good to excellent Starwood properties (I have stayed at them all at least once). I seem to return most frequently to The Palace (yes I do like the name).
Why you might ask? There is a list of reasons...
First of all they do have good rates for a hotel of it's class.
The entry way is beautiful. providing a sense that one has arrived.; parking fees are a little steep, but that is true for San Francisco at large. If you do choose to valet you will be greeted by prompt, helpful, and friendly valets.
The staff have always been friendly and professional. I have always felt welcomed. Gerrard with his distinguished sense of French style, told me with a genuine smile that I had been upgraded to a beautiful suite last time I stayed. Indeed it was, a marble bathroom with a jetted tub and separate shower; a very comfortable bed; and a lovely living room with an original chandelier so beautiful I wish I could have shrunk it and taken it home with me... I like that the furniture, it is functional and antique (I like antiques , they provide a timelessness that is relaxing). Even the most basic rooms I have stayed in have had a sense of simple elegance - comfortable. However, being Platinum I have usually been upgraded.
The Pied Piper bar in the lobby caters to locals and guests alike, in fact on a Friday it can be quite crowded which is good if you like people watching and making new friends. They make very good cocktails and they do have a few hotel exclusives. They also serve food in the bar, but you may prefer to venture out to one of the city's great restaurants. Breakfast is served in the Palace room with the original stained glass ceiling you must see while you are here, a true work of beauty. As is the pool area, which has a large glass ceiling, hot tub, and dry sauna; I always make time for taking a swim at The Palace. The hotel is centrally located... close to shopping, Market cafes on the Bay, museums and... What do you want to experience on your visit to San Francisco? I am sure you can find it close by if not at the Palace.< /review>

<Review>I stayed here in February and they were mid-remodel and I happened to stay in a newly remodeled room (I thought) but with an old desk and TV. The response to my review was that the new furniture would be in soon for the desk/TV.

Well that new desk/TV combination makes a huge difference. The TV is now mounted and the desk is clutter free and available as a work area for my computer. They also have new outlets in the furniture so that was also much better.

The beds here are so comfortable I don't want to leave them and they still have all of the 5 star amenities in the bathroom, including luxury robe and amazing towels, that I expect from a 5 star hotel.

Great job Palace Hotel!</Review><Pics>None</Pics>< resp>

<Rating>None< /Rating><review>From the moment you arrive at the Palace Hotel and are greated by the gentlemen at the Porte-cochere and the Bell Men who assist with your luggage, you know you are starting your stay at the Historical Palace Hotel to be a wonderful experiance.
The front desk staff, very professional and most courtious, if you are a return guest you are welcomed with your last name and asked if there is anything the hotel staff can do for you.
The facilicity is gracious with the beautiful Garden Court and the Pied Piper lounge. The rooms are large with high ceilings. The indoor pool is most relaxing, just what is needed after a long day of travel. From maticulous house keeping to in room dining, one couldn't ask for more. If you want to step back in time, join the Garaden Court for brunch or high tea on Sunday. For cocktails, view the Maxfield Parish painting behind the bar, a true historical treasure, not to mention the gentlemen behind the bar serving up what every your heart desires. Louge dining is most enjoyable with a great menu for just a snak or full on dining experience.
Last but not least the ladies and gentlemen at the Concerige desk are a treasure of knowledge, and can assist you with tours, transportation, theatre tickets, dining reservations, shopping, shipping, boarding passes, and much more. They are my go to at the hotel.
A frequent return guest.<//review>< Pictures>

<Rating>None</Rating><Text>If you want an historic San Francisco hotel experience the Palace fits the bill. Huge public spaces are adorned with beautiful wood, soaring ceilings and fresh flowers. It's worth stopping in just to see the goregeous stained glass atrium in the Garden Court. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. Front desk staff is always great, and special requests handled easily. This is one of the few SF hotels with a swimming pool and a beautiful one at that. It's also in a great location on Market Street, close to shopping, restaurants and the waterfront. For those using public transportation, a BART/Muni station is right outside the door.</Text>< Pics>

<Name>RVT21</Name>< date>
1475452800000<//date>
<rate>None</rate>< review>
I was simply amazed by how awesome the staff were! I Got there at about 11:30am, well before the 3pm check in, but they still had a room ready for me (On a Friday too). After a long day of walking 10 miles across San Fran, I took an uber home, but forgot my phone in the car. I couldn't call it because the battery was dead. The staff here did everything they could to try and contact uber and help me find how to contact the driver! It was so nice because the issue had nothing to do with them at all. I was able to get ahold of the driver who brought my phone about 90mins later, but during that time of me waiting outside, the staff had nice conversations with me and even gave me 2 free drink vouchers to make up for my stress. They were very empathetic and all awesome. If for no other reason than this, I'll gladly stay here anytime I'm in San Fran! The room was nice and quiet too, but I wasn't in the room much since it was my only day in San Fran. Also the lounge area is BEAUTIFUL!< /review>

<text>The Palace in SF is always a quality experience. The staff are fantastic and as a hopeless romantic, the property is beautiful. Great location and a take you back in time experience.<//text><Pics>None<//Pics><Resp>None<//Resp>< Gmap_id>

< Gmap_id>
0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb</Gmap_id>
< Name>
Chris Stark</Name>
<pics>None<//pics>< text>
The palace hotel truly lives up to its namesake. That all starts with the staff which were top notch to say the least. I loved the high ceilings throughout the hotel, in the room itself I'd estimate then at 12 ft. The bathroom isn't huge but, sufficient. It's not the best shower combo, but having the rain faucet and a wand helps make up for that. Breakfast, under the atrium, is well worth it. The wait staff was attentive and the views is stunning. There is an excellent spread of traditional options along with a great assortment of fresh fruit, cheeses, pastries, smoked salmon, etc. If you're offered to include breakfast in your booking it's $38 on site, but bookable online $40 for two. Unfortunately We did not get the chance to check out the pool, but given everything else here I'd expect it to give a sense of refined luxury. San Francisco has so many great options to choose from at these price points and the Palace is good value here.</text>

< review>
The hotel staff was amazing, and the hotel itself is beautiful. The event staff that we worked with were a professional group of individuals that kept our meeting running smoothly. We received plenty of compliments for the venue choice. 
As for my personal experience, my room had a leak the morning. I was moved right away to another room and received a handwritten letter of apology and received some complimentary treats. It was very considerate, and when I come back to San Francisco again for a personal visit, I'll make sure to visit this hotel again. Thank you again for the hospitality and professionalism!<//review>

<Rate>None< /Rate><Review>I recently enjoyed a 5 night stay at The Palace. Clearly the hotel facility is a beautifully renovated historic hotel but it is the level of service provided by the staff which is most remarkable. Over the duration of my stay there were a handful of staff members who remembered my name throughout and went out of their way to see to it I had everything I needed. As an example, the housekeeping attendants had just finished cleaning my room one afternoon when I returned and there had been some wine glasses in the room. <text>I have rarely enjoyed a short stay so much as at the Palace Hotel...the great features: large rooms, central location, and Old World feel, plus the matchless Garden Court, remain. The staff are superb: Alan at the parking garage and Krista at the front desk in particular made me feel at home. And the fitness center has been upgraded and now are at the high level of the rest of the hotel. < username>
Allie7654</username>
< Text>
The Palace is a beautiful building - there's real wow factor when you walk in. Also, the location is perfect - right next to a BART stop and close to a lot of things in SF. Our room was on the 7th floor and was lovely - looked like one of the recently renovated ones. But there are definitely quite a few things that could use improvement. First of all - at check-in there's a special line for SPG gold/platinum members, but it wasn't open when I arrived. I had to wait a really long time to check in. Not the end of the world, but if you're going to have that as a benefit, it should be open when guests arrive. I had put in my reservation my arrival time. In fact we really didn‚Äôt get any SPG recogtion at all despite being SPG Gold. Secondly, we didn't get a turn down service. I saw online that the hotel offered it and usually left chocolates on the pillows, but nothing for us. It just seemed the service in general was lacking for such a nice hotel. Also, the food at both the Garden Court restaurant and room service was mediocre. And very pricy. And there are no coffee makers in the room, one of my biggest pet peeves. No mini bar either - just an empty fridge. The best thing about this hotel is the lobby. It's beautiful. I just don't think I'd stay here again just for that.</Text>

<rating>None<//rating><username>Lilipadz<//username>< Resp>

<Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//Gmap_id>< date>
1473292800000< /date>
<user_id>None< /user_id>< review>
Due to major flight delay and flight cancellation shenanigans, my husband and I were already exhausted from lingering around SFO airport for several hours. 

When we checked into Palace hotel, we mentioned of our delayed flight. The check-in agent was friendly and welcoming. For once, when I politely asked if we can get a suite upgrade with my Platinum status, the agent actually made an effort to check suite availability and was able to make it happen. It probably helped that my husband mentioned they'd get the room back early in the morning. The suite was spacious and beautiful. Although it's an older hotel, the classy furnishings and decor were very much up to date. 

One minor issue was the toiletries were already half used. When I talked to guest services, they quickly brought a brand new set. We loved our stay and appreciated the Platinum recognition. I wish we didn't have to leave as early in the morning so we could try the Platinum breakfast.</review>

<text>I've lived in this area for 33 years and never taken note of the Palace.  Now I can't imagine staying elsewhere!  I love the architecture, so old and elaborate.  But then the rooms have a certain modernity to them that I really enjoyed.  The beds were as comfy as anything I've ever slept in.  The room was perfectly appointed in every way.  Even if you can't really justify the expense to stay there, stop by and have a drink in the Garden Court!  Their drinks are top notch, swanky appetizers, leave feeling like a big shot.  Prices are commensurate with the experience, this is not a cheap date.  Totally worth it if a grand experience is what you want.</text></record>

< Text>
I was in San Francisco for a business meeting at Moscone. As a woman traveling alone, security is always a concern to me There were doormen at the door and security in the lobby. The hotel is a very short walk from the Market Street BART exit. Saturday morning I made a short half mile walk to the Ferry building.
This hotel is knock your socks off beautiful. I had tea here in the 1970's with a friends auntie. The memories of the tea in that grand room were always with me. I'm so glad I had a chance to return and enjoy the full experience as an adult. I was greeted by Jane, she was wonderful, charming and welcoming.. I was given a room on the 8th floor facing Market Street. The first thing that impressed me was how large the room was. Those eleven foot ceilings take your breath away
 The bathroom with it's marble floor and walk in shower was much larger than I expected and the Toto toilet with it's heated seat and full service bidet was a welcome treat for the travel weary. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. Loved the linens.
 Everything was wonderful. I look forward to visiting again.<//Text>

Stayed for 2 nights for our 12 yr anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed the comfort and cleanliness. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were treated to champagne and chocolate, which was a nice surprise. Convenient location. Walkable to Ferry Building (15 mins) for Napa Tour and to Pier 33 (25mins) for Alcatraz departure, SF playhouse (15min). The room was small but we were hardly there, so didn't matter to us. Would highly recommend. Cons: the walls are thin, could hear guy next door talking; on market st. could hear the traffic slightly, but we weren't bothered.</review>

<name>Schwabbie89< /name><Time>1477612800000<//Time><rate>None< /rate>< Review>
This is a beautiful property, however, if you are SPG Gold, don't expect any type of upgrade or recognition, even on paid stays. I stayed here for 5 nights a few weeks back. When I arrived, the front desk told me there were no upgrades available for the length of my stay, but there were plenty of rooms showing on the hotel's website. I truly believe they lied to my face. After 2 nights in a tiny room with no view, I saw availability on the website for an upgraded room, went back to the front desk, asked for a better room, and the same thing happened. When I politely pushed them, they "found" an upgraded room they could move me to for a fee. Sick of my tiny room, I reluctantly agreed to the increased rate and moved. This property does not value it's loyal members. I have to travel to SF consistently for work spending $3,000 - $4,000 per week. I'll most likely give my business to another hotel going forward. I realize that the Marriott merger has bombarded them with Marriott Gold/Platinum members who have matched their status with SPG, but I think the Palace should place a priority on those of us who have been Loyal to them for years. Truly, truly disappointed.<//Review>

<Text>As I‚Äôm at dinner at Olive Garden this evening, I am still completely in shock about the last 24 hours in which I spent at the Palace Hotel. Expecting royal treatment was obviously an extreme mistake! First of all, this IS NOT the place to stay in SF. From start to finish, my stay at the Palace hotel was disappointing to say the least. Although the staff was nice, that does not make up for the lack of service in an establishment like this. On a Friday evening they had only 1 doorman, who was obviously overwhelmed when we came to valet. 15 mins later we were finally checking in. Unfortunately our room was not ready (it was 7:30pm, check in is supposed to be at 3) so we were offered some drink cards from the restaurant while we wait, and were told it would only be 30 mins or so. We had prior dinner arrangements cancelled them due to our room not being ready. Unfortunately the service we received in the Pied Piper lounge was horrible. We were basically ignored the entire meal. We were seated in the back corner at a table that was obviously in need of fixing (since it wobbled so much we had to move) my ‚Äúfree drink‚Äù was disgusting and although I sent it back twice it was still put on my bill, and the appetizer that we ordered never came. The restaurant manager was sweet and sent a bottle of champagne to our room as well as comped our meal since I tried to pay for it but walked out since the server just walked past me twice as I held the bill out for her to take. We had of course left our bags with the bell desk to deliver to our room when it was ready. Since we were told at 8:40 that our room was finally ready for us, I told the bell desk our room number and asked again for our bags to be taken up, so after we dealt with the restaurant manager we finally went to our room. To our disappointment, it was NOT and upgraded room that we been told we were waiting for, it was the deluxe room the we had originally booked. And our bags were no where to be found. I called down to the bell desk and asked them to bring our bags up, but 45 minutes later we went down to retrieve them ourselves. After trying to laugh off this horrific stay, we decided to do some face masks and watch a movie. I pulled out the ice bucket drawer and it almost crushed my foot when it fell on the floor because it is broken. And then of course the tv remote had crusty old nasty stuff on the buttons! So we ordered a movie using tissues to cover our fingers so we could press the buttons. Our ‚Äúcomplimentary breakfast‚Äù for all of the issues was blah. We were again seated in a corner with a table so wobbly that my coffee split without me even drinking it. The food wasn‚Äôt great, and I honestly ended up taking an orange and banana for my flight out. (I ate decent food at the airport later) Checking out was the icing on the cake. After all the issues, we were offered for our movie, dinner and breakfast to be complimentary and a free upgrade on our next stay! Wow! Palace Hotel, I promise you, we will NEVER stay at this establishment again!!! The lack of care or concern of quality for your guests comfort is truly appalling. As such a ‚Äúfine hotel‚Äù I expected a higher standard than Holiday Inn but that‚Äôs basically the quality we got (except their breakfast is always complimentary). $300 for a room after everything ‚Äúwas comped.‚Äù A waste of time and money.... stay anywhere else in SF!!!</Text>< user_id>

<Text>The Palace is an interesting hotel, comfortable, and a very good location for the hub of activity in San Francisco. However, if you want a quiet area, go somewhere else. <Rating>None</Rating><review>Overall, the Palace is a lovely hotel. It is in a prime location and the building itself is amazing. It's obviously San Francisco, so outside can be a bit noisy, but you'd expect that in any hotel.

The major downside during my stay was breakfast. The dining room is rather small, so there is only room for ~100 people to dine at a time. Not a big deal, but we were told that the wait would be ~20-25 minutes when it ended up being closer to 50-55 minutes. On many days this would just be a inconvenience, but we had a flight to catch, which didn't make the situation ideal. Then, once we were seated, we didn't have a waiter come to us to offer coffee / juice and explain the different menu options. After 10 minutes of waiting, I asked someone who brushed the request aside, and then asked the man who was seemingly the head of the restaurant. 10 minutes after that, I went up to the waiter stand and had to grab the OJ and bring it over as that was the only way I was going to get service that day apparently. The breakfast experience really ruined what is a fabulous hotel.</review><pictures>None</pictures><resp>None< /resp><GmapID>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb</GmapID></record></dataset><record>

< text>
The hotel is absolutely gorgeous & great location! The staff was responsive & courteous at all times. Our major complaint was the food. We had lunch & the food was just OK. I would have never found out that you had a turndown service to begin with if I had not asked a colleague who traveled with me and stayed at the same hotel. 5</Rating>
< Review>
The Palace Hotel is wonderful. Guest services are very friendly and will accommodate your every need. My wife and I stayed for a few days on our honeymoon and loved almost everything. The pool is designed for working out and not so much for vacationing. I enjoyed the restaurant but they have a limited selection. The breakfast buffet was exceptional, but a little expensive. I hate to complain about price at a 5-star hotel, but regular coffee should not cost seven dollars. Besides that everything else has been marvelous. The location is perfect for tourism. There's a 15 minute walk to Chinatown or to the Port of San Francisco. We will definitely stay again but probably eat out on the town.</Review>

<Rating>None< /Rating>< review>
Our too-short visit to San Francisco was enhanced by a very comfortable stay at The Palace Hotel. The historic hotel's spectacular Garden Room demands a visit (as does its Ghiaradeli Ice Cream Shop!).Our room was sparkling clean with comfortable beds and down comforters and pillows. The staff was very personable, professional and helpful with directions and suggestions for dining, etc. The Palace is also very well situated near Union Square, the theatre district, Chinatown and North Beach-all within a healthy walking distance. I think we have found a new favorite place to stay!</review>

< Review>
My husband and I decided to stay at The Palace for our wedding anniversary visit. I am a Lifetime Platinum Rewards member with Marriott, so now have the same status with SPG. Therefore, we were told we'd be upgraded to a larger room on the top floor, and given "special recognition" for our anniversary. Well, a room on the top floor was not ready when we checked in (3 pm, the "legal" time) so we ended up on the 4th floor. The front desk clerk also missed the fact that we'd booked a rate that included the breakfast buffet. I had to inquire about it. The room we got was large and lovely but NO dresser drawers!!! Just a closet?! When I called the front desk, they told me that to maintain the "integrity of the rooms" (whatever that means?) rooms had either a closet OR a dresser?! I was offered to switch to a room with drawers, but no closet?! We stayed put. There was also no light in the closet. Hard to see in the evening. We were given a lovely bottle of wine. On checking out we saw we'd been charged for breakfast one morning ($92 for two persons) even though our rate included breakfast. The bill was corrected, but it never should have happened.
Staff were very nice.<//Review>

< review>
My 9yo and I recently stayed at this hotel and we BOTH loved it. The staff was fantastic (from bellmen, to front desk to housekeepers), the room was huge, and the hotel in general was gorgeous and historic. As always, the beds were super comfortable and there was an array of different pillow types for feather v. foam sleepers. My son loved the pool and we met nice kids and parents up on the pool deck relaxing in the late afternoon.

On the note of children, this hotel was particularly kid friendly and sent cookies and milk up for my son on check in. There also appeared to be a number of kid activities (that we really did not have time for).

This hotel is convenient to public transportation and it's easy to walk to tons of things (Alcatraz, China town etc.) from here. 

We cannot wait to go back!< /review>

<user_name>bluegrass< /user_name></record>
</dataset><record>
<Rate>3< /Rate><resp>None</resp><Pics>None</Pics>< review>
It is a beautiful Hotel... but def not worth the expense! Just visit  by getting an ice cream at the Ghirardelli in their lobby, which is by the way always extremely crowded. Dont be fooled by the pictures, double rooms have only full size beds, NO queen available. No coffee maker in the standard rooms. That was my bad research.  My husband and I and our 14yr old son  thought we would stick it out... but after the first night we called the front desk for options. When we asked if another room was available with kings or a roll out bed, we couldnt. We had to upgrade to a suite as all king size rooms with a pull out couch were booked & you can not get a roll out bed in the doubles (something about california law??) . We decided to upgrade to a suite: For the very "good deal" of $250 per night! The suite was indeed amazing, but way too pricey! The place was clean, which it should for the money!  Do not eat breakfast there or room service unless you want to break the bank. $150.00 for 3 very standard eggs was insane. The indoor pool is unique and cool.  They have a hot tub, which we used every early morning. After walking around all day for 10 days our bodies were Sore! It helped. As the lobby is open to tourists, you need your key fob to use the elevators which is annoying  when they dont work. Had to get it 2 of our key fobs switched 2x.<//review>

<response>None</response><user_id>115362898003952244191</user_id><Text>Nice hotel in terms of decor on the common areas, but the hallways to the rooms themselves felt a bit dank. I checked in early because apparently my room was ready and I received an upgrade with my gold elite status.

When I arrived, I was a bit surprised that my gold elite upgrade ended me up on a 2nd floor room facing loud Market st. It was also very far from the elevator. Neither of my requests (high floor, close to elevator) were met. I am unsure what aspect of the room was an upgrade.

Note: You can't even take the stairs if you wanted to because the layout doesn't support stairs too well (it's technically an emergency exit). So you are forced to take the elevator even from floor 2.

The windows were not soundproof because I could hear the sound of muni busses and yelling homeless people. I did contact them over the app about it, but thought that since my stay was only one night, I did not want to bother with switching rooms.

In terms of hotel layout, this place is huge. You may end up walking 5min from the elevator to get to your room as that is how large it is.

I did not try any of the restaurants. I have heard there is 75 dollar high tea in the lounge.

Location wise, it is convenient if you need to be close to Fidi or Soma, but if you know how SF is these days, homeless mental people are often around in this area, so stay safe and avoid eye contact.< /Text><Date>1567432222271</Date>< rate>

< review>
Beautiful property. The rooms are newly furnished and filled with lovely touches. Only three issues: One, the Hostess at the Garden Court didn't want to allow us to get a coffee at breakfast, saying that she didn't have any free tables ... other than the fact that I was looking at twenty free tables. She then qualified that she didn't have any free tables at 12:30 (we were there at 11:30). We went around the block to Starbucks. Second, minor issue, my bathroom door wouldn't close. Perhaps something with the hinge. Third, the cleaning crew was pretty loud in the hallway and woke me up both days. I'm guessing this is due to the rooms being so shallow. All these are minor concerns to me. I love the property, location, and price point. The Conceirges (all three lovely Ladies) we brilliant in securing us last minute dinner reservations. I will definitely be back and will make the Palace my default hotel for business and leisure in SF.</review>

Thanks for organising the welcome gift. Additionally I appreciate you providing a Junior Suite upgrade to make my stay more comfortable.

I wanted to ensure that the comments received you directly and avoided completing the in room card.

It is currently just before 0300hrs.

I have had a number of disappointments with my stay in your hotel and I wanted to share this with you.

1) Upon arrival at 1415hrs my room was un-available
2) Left luggage and departed for town. Upon return at 2045 I requested the bags be delivered to the room. I popped to the bar. 2130 in the room ( without my baggage ). Was informed upon going to reception that bags are not delived to rooms if one is not in the room ?? If so - this could have been mentioned at reception
3) Upon arrival to the room ahead of the baggage team the attached photos(in zip file) indicate the 'old' room service left outside my room at 2130.
4) Since just a prior to midnight until time of writing - no running water in the room. Apparently as I was informed upon calling down maintenance was being carried out. This resulted in a very uncomfortable stay. Unable to shower and the toilet could not be used due to the natural risks I am sure you are aware of.
What was particularly annoying is that NO ONE considered informing the guests.

<name>Richardhere</name>< Date>

<rate>None<//rate><Text>The Palace is a Grande Dame hotel that has not been permitted to fall into faded glory status. Unless you opt for a junior suite or suite, the rooms are not very big, but they are very comfortable, and are well serviced in terms of housekeeping, etc. I have been staying there whenever I visit San Francisco for the last several years. It's location is very hard to beat. People should avoid driving and parking in San Francisco, but it's not a problem because it's a city blessed with abundant public transportation options. The hotel's Market Street entrance faces the Montgomery BART/MUNI stop. You can get on BART at SFO and arrive at your hotel about 30 minutes later. To explore the city, you have MUNI right there and are within strolling distance of many iconic sights in the city.</Text><pics>None<//pics>< Resp>

< Review>
Every stay is about people. People play an important role at my stays at Starwood Hotels. And the associates from the Palace Hotel were very friendly and forthcoming.
Also my SPG Gold status was greatly recognized with a wonderful room upgrade. The room was clean and spacey, and the Spa/Pool/Whirlpool is a great place to relax in the heart of San Francisco. The Palace is a well located hotel combined with a jaw dropping architecture and great restaurants in the building.
All in all, the staff made my stay in SF perfect. I recommend the Palace.</Review>

There was no room service, no coffee machine, and a limited and expensive breakfast buffet service. Additional the hotel bars and restaurants were either not open, or only open for a couple of hours.

SGryphon< /Name>
<Date>1499558400000< /Date><rate>None<//rate><review>I'm a regular visitor to San Francisco and thought I'd expand my repertoire of hotels on a recent visit, but was disappointed with numerous elements at this hotel, and specifically the upgrade policy for Platinum members. SPG status recognition is not a priority here! I requested a slightly early early check-in of 3:00 PM since the hotel has a later-than-average 4:00 PM check-in. I repeated this request when the concierge contacted me prior to arrival and also stated a preference for a room with a sitting area if possible. When I arrived at 3:00 PM, I was offered a standard room, the option to wait for an upgraded room, or another option to pay a surcharge that was higher than even the room rate for a Deluxe Suite. I agreed to wait and when the hotel called 90 minutes minutes later to tell me my room was ready, I received a small room with no sitting area or view. When I called to see if I could at least get a room with a street view, they promised to call back with options, and 90 minutes later I was still waiting. When I finally went to the front desk to request a room change, they lowered the surcharge for the suite but insisted that it could not be waved. While I assume the hotel might offer the technicality that it was a "Deluxe Suite" and did not fall into the category of a standard suite, it was a basic corner suite that a W, Westin or Sheraton would have no issue upgrading a platinum member to on a complimentary basis. In addition, when I looked at room availability online, there were numerous rooms available in a higher category that what I had been offered, and that provided street views. Apparently none were ready for check-in by 6:00 PM. Add to this that while an SPG plaque is present at the front desk, there is no separate queue, so as a platinum member, you have to step around the line of waiting guests and be subject to them being upset with you in order to enjoy the benefit of an expedited check-in</review>< pictures>

<Rating>None< /Rating><Text>While the overall appearance of the hotel is beautiful, the rooms were pretty and the Garden Court really amazing, the execution of day to day stuff was terrible. The check-in line stretched back out of the lobby and into the dining room - maybe 30+ people deep and barely moving - people had taken to laying on the floor. Only two people working the desk at peak hours? Who thought that was a good idea? I had to ask about a platinum line and was allowed to jump ahead but even that took quite a while and wasn't something the hotel made any effort to facilitate. The rooms are very pretty, definitely "European petite" in size and have little water pressure - it took my wife 20 minutes to get the shampoo out of her hair. Also no functioning air conditioning. The noise outside the hotel at night had us awake before dawn each day. Location would be good during the week but on weekends the financial district (and all the restaurants) closes. < Review>
As usual, the Palace was wonderful. Nothing quite like the crisp white sheets, excellent mattress and firm and supporting pillows. I ordered room service this trip...I was little too tired to step outside. The chophouse salad was wonderful and the shrimp cocktail...perfect complement. I had the dimsum for the entree. <user_name>icecorner<//user_name><Date>1514937600000</Date><Rate>None</Rate>< review>
The hotel has checked a lot of boxes. Great location, very grand garden court, and absolutely beautiful high ceiling rooms with some old charms but updated amenities. And among all of those, the price is very reasonable for the quality the hotel provides. There are some small imperfection, however. The front desk staff did not recognize my elite status, and also did not mention the benefits of the package that I booked until I inquired about it. The turn down service is a nice touch, but it would have been better if a bucket of ice was provided. To be honest, these are really nitpicking. I wouldn't hesitate to book the hotel again if I'm around the area.</review>

RaymondG1978< /name>
< date>
1426809600000</date>
< Rate>
None< /Rate>
< Review>
The Palace Hotel is one of the most romantic hotels in San Francisco. This hotel is timeless and elegant when you first check-in. I have stayed here about 10 or 15 times and I always feel like I have escaped to 1930's San Francisco with the fortunate realization of having modern technology. Walking in the hallways alone lets you know this hotel is historic because the attention to details on the doors, walls, rugs is magnificent. The chandeliers add an accent to every part of the hotel. The rooms are plush and the bathrooms have high quality amenities. The hotel bar is the best place to have client meetings and after you are done - GO TO THE ROOFTOP POOL and JACUZZI. This is one of the few hotels in San Francisco that has an indoor pool and hot tub that allows you to relax. This hotel is one of the best in the world and if you don't stay here... you will regret it!< /Review>

0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb<//GmapID>
<userid>None< /userid><name>EvanK1984<//name>< review>
Upon arrival at the listed arrival time, we were told that our room, and no rooms within that type were ready due to needing to be cleaned. We were not early, but rather on time. There was. I explanation given and we were pointed to a bar where we could wait. We had to check our bags and join all the other guests waiting for their rooms.

Two hours later, after spending more than we would have preferred and having to get a code to use a bathroom, we got to our room and could prepare for our dinner reservations. These were delayed even further because one of our bags was lost from the checking and I had to go to the storage room and find it.

When we checked out, we could see the same problem unfolding for the travelers arriving that day. Waiting around, even sleeping in the lobby/bar.

The staff was trying and the facilities were nice, but clearly there was not enough staff on hand to take care of the number of guests.

$60 for parking, no rooms upon our arrival, lost bag and overworked staff. Not the luxury we had in mind I'm afraid.</review>

</record></dataset><record>
< UserId.>
None< /UserId.>
< name>
Susieqdive</name>
<time>1401235200000</time><Rate>None</Rate>< Text>
If you wish to take a trip back in time to the luxury or yore during your SF stay...this is the place to be. Since it is an older, historic Grande Dame of a hotel the rooms can range from fantastic to adequate but there are so many other reasons to stay here. The atmosphere of SF's storied past surrounds you in the best way possible. There is no better way to begin a day than to have breakfast in the Palace's beautiful Garden Court. The bustling,trendy bar is crowned with a Maxfield Parrish painting to die for. The 4th floor indoor pool is worth a peek even if you don't swim. Fitness room good and served by helpful staff. Public spaces and hallway display cases are filled with interesting photos and documents. Above all the staff is uniformly helpful.</Text>

< userid>
102573644195804095315<//userid>
<Name>Greg S</Name><date>1554478862037<//date><rate>5<//rate><Text>Very nice hotel. Enjoyed my stay. Helpful employees<//Text>< Pictures>

<resp>None< /resp><GmapID>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb</GmapID></record></dataset><record>
<Gmap_id>0x808580881f0c9dd7:0xbe09e1083f7d7fcb< /Gmap_id><user_id>None<//user_id><pictures>None< /pictures>< Text>
I was hesitant to book The Palace based on quite a few negative reviews. Was on the fence with St Regis as I've stayed there in the past and had a great experience. Ultimately I decided to try out the Palace.

From the moment we arrived at the front door, we received outstanding service. The bellman took our bags and was very informative and courteous.

We waited less than a minute in line to check in. As we arrived at 1PM, I wasn't expecting our room to be ready. Without having to ask, I was told that I was upgraded to a Superior Suite. Great SPG recognition. They took my phone # and called me just around 4PM informing me my room was ready.

Upon entering our suite, the first thing that strikes you is the beautiful detail of the room. 11 foot high ceilings with ultra-white crown moldings with tasteful light gray walls appointed with more ultra-white moldings on the walls. There was a nice desert waiting for us as I had told them we were celebrating my daughters birthday.

The bathroom featured a very clean white marble palette with the TOTO "drinking fountain." The bed was very comfortable with no bed bugs to be found. (I do check every hotel for bed bugs)

We enjoyed the indoor pool and jacuzzi. Although the pool did appear to be heated, it could have been 10 degrees warmer. The gym was generously sized with all the standard equipment.

As a Platinum, I selected the breakfast award. Great choice! Probably one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had. For an extra $7, you can get the full buffet which featured all the hot and cold selections. Not sure if I'd pay the full $39 for it, but it was absolutely worth trying as an award. The only minor complaint is that they seated us in the corner next to the bussing station. But we were dressed like tourists so that was understandable. The regular clientele were definitely business folk during the week.

We decided to take BART back to the Oakland airport. Montgomery St Station is right outside the Hotel, so that was a breeze.


Overall, an outstanding stay. Great service from all staff, great SPG recognition, great location. Will definitely be back with the rest of the family.< /Text>

< Review>
The check-in staff did not really specially recognize your status ( at least in my case ), although they did mention choose between breakfast and welcome points. But that's about it. 

 I booked junior suite but I did not realize I had the wrong date of booking (due to my time lag in Beijing). Fortunately they fixed the booking and gave me the room when I actually arrived one day ahead. 

I booked junior suite but was assigned a second floor Grande Deluxe room. Was told that there was no big difference between the two room types...Ok, 2nd floor is a bit noisy to help good sleep. And as a platinum member, this should be an upgrade rather than downgrade? Extremely disappointed in this. 

I do understand that for the first day it is a last minute change so no suite is there, but for the second day I do have the junior suite booked and confirmed. But this is not an option mentioned by the check-in staff. 

Breakfast is superb, well worth the price. But again, I forgot to bring the voucher the first day and was charged for the full price.

Overall it is a good but not decent hotel. I would consider stay here next time, but not sure about that. So many options in SFO.</Review>

<rate>None<//rate>< time>
1446336000000</time>
< Name>
Arizona</Name>
<Resp>None< /Resp>< text>
The Palace is beautiful. We loved breakfast in the Garden Court and returned each afternoon for cocktails before dinner. We had a great dinner at the Pied Piper restaurant, too.
Our room was clean, but small. I was told we were upgraded (as a Gold guest), but I'm fairly sure our room was the same room we had booked- it was very small and had no drawers for unpacking clothes. We ended up with suitcases on the the floor in the room because there was nowhere to put our clothes. There is a massive headboard/nightstand built in, but there were no drawers in it. I expect to be able to unpack my clothes when I book a stay at a hotel as expensive as the Palace.
Finally, most of the front desk staff left me disappointed. I asked one of the front desk staff if he would mind taking a picture of my husband and I- his response was, "If you are quick about it." If he was too busy, he should have offered someone else who might have been able to take the picture- his response was just rude (especially given that taking a picture takes much less than a minute). The Concierge team was great, though- they were the most thoughtful employees I encountered at the hotel.
All in all, the palace is a beautiful hotel and we had a great stay. It would have been even better if the employees seemed eager to help and the rooms had a place to put your folded clothes.</text>

< rate>
None<//rate>
< Text>
The Palace Hotel is simply elegant. It's architecture and decor initially dazzles with light and color play that soon allows you to feel very comfortable. The staff's friendliness continues the comfort level so you can enjoy the ammenities the hotel has to offer.

The air comfort control near the entrance to the room was easy to program and delivered the desired comfort zone. The king size bed was like nesting in quality linens yet firm for a deep sleep. The bathroom had a beautiful old marble counter, scounces that dimmed on each side of a large gold gilded mirror and ample space to manuever. A small round magnified mirror on an arm was available as well for close up work. The water pressure was steady and strong with immediate hot water.

My only concern was the carpet and the bathroom floor needed some cleaning attention.

I have and will recommend the Palace to friends and family. I will also be staying at the Palace again.< /Text>

< Text>
Grand hotel, great style, very centrally located but with mediocre service. Long queue for check-in. Not enough restaurants and space for guests so that without a reservation you end up having to go outside for breakfast! Rooms on Market Street have interesting views but are loud. Rooms in courtyard are quiet but since courtyard is narrow you are to close to rooms across. Beds are comfortable. Valet parking can be slow to retrieve your car at busy times. It took once 30' (maybe an exception). All-in-all a bit of a disappointment.</Text>

< review>
I am a Gold member with SPG and have had a great experience at various Luxury Collection hotels but this experience was the worst that I have encountered with any hotel.  When I arrived at the hotel, I found that I had to cross a picket line to get into the hotel.  When I found that the hotel had been under protest by their hotel staff for nearly a month, I was disappointed that the hotel or Marriott did not inform me of the impact it would have on my stay so I could have made other arrangements.  The noise from the protesters was continuous and loud from 7am to 9:30pm every day.  Because there was very limited staff, many of the services that I expect as standard for a hotel of this caliber were not available.  This stay was a pleasure trip and it was not.</review>

<user_id>None< /user_id>< Name>
Seattlenerd</Name>
< time>
1336780800000<//time>
< Rating>
None< /Rating>
< Text>
I've been staying at the Palace at least once a year for a decade, and I was reminded during a stay last week why I appreciate it compared to many other properties: the attention to detail.

From the complimentary shoe shine service to the on-request in-room coffee maker (with both excellent dark roast coffee and green tea in single-serving cups), the Palace has thoughtful amenities, even for the frequent business traveler.

The only oddity on this recent stay was the newspaper delivery -- three different papers (SF Chronicle, USA Today, Wall Street Journal) on three different mornings. And a room safe that failed to open when I was checking out, due to a dead battery. But the latter was quickly remedied by engineering, who showed up immediately.

Worth noting :the location is excellent for those coming from SFO and want to take BART, as a BART station is directly outside the doors of the hotel on Market.<//Text>

<userid>None</userid><name>Makas</name>< Time>
1490227200000< /Time>
<Rating>None<//Rating>< review>
I cant believe after a 6 year absence from this property (busy with work and stuff. finally got to take a vacation) The staff actually remembered me. I use to stay here a lot and it was great to see familiar faces and so glad to be remembered. Makes this a very special place for me. I was greeted at the front desk by Jenny and Scott. Great reception. It wasn't too busy so we got to chat a bit. Even got some hiking tips. Hiking in San Francisco? Who would have thought. Later that day I saw Taka who immediately said "Hiiiii. Wow its been about 5 or 6 years" aw, she remembered.
Malia from the concierge desk happened to be passing by and immediately gave me a hug and said welcome back. Wow! Im impressed ten fold. Also, got to see Jorge. haha alway so courteous and a great smile.
My room looked new. I think its been renovated and looks really nice. THE BED! OMGeee. Sank into it and woke up the next morning in the exact same position. So comfortable.
I had to enjoy the beautiful Garden Court so sat there in the evening and had a beautiful glass of Wine that was recommended by Andrew(i think... I think Im wrong tho. sorry) Such a nice young man. I actually had 2 glasses with the Steak Tartar and a cheese and cracker platter. YUM! There was a young man on a guitar and I just didn't want to leave. The ambiance was spectacular. So, I went back to have the Grand Tea on Saturday. With Champagne of course. LOVED IT!
ok this is getting long and im sorry but I cant say enough great things about this property. I am also trying to get back in October. A friend told me. You just gotta make the time.
Ill see you all soon and thank you so much for a great experience.< /review>

<rating>None< /rating>< Text>
The Pied Piper bar is a classic, with special meaning to us (it's where she said "yes!") But over the years the service has gone from slow to abysmal. Three people serving drinks *and dinner* to a large bar crammed full of people on a busy weekend just isn't close to enough. Why do they think it is?

Also, late checkout just doesn't work. There are electronic locks, so the maids could just swipe a card to see if the door is locked. But instead they pound on the door every 15 minutes, and just don't comprehend the notion of having a leisurely Sunday breakfast in bed. After the 10th time (literally) I opened the door and the look on my face evidently got the point across. But by then, the mood was not what we were hoping for. Sigh.< /Text>

<user>110159577087327353989<//user>< name>
Simon Tompson<//name>
< date>
1387627962236< /date>
<rate>5</rate><review>I stayed here for six nights in December and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. I've stayed in about 5 different hotels in downtown San Francisco and this was the first one I've experienced with a genuinely quiet room, without all the noise of sirens from the street. If you're a light sleeper like me, be sure to ask for a room facing the inner courtyard.

The hotel oozes quality and is staffed with friendly, polite employees. Decor is beautiful, celebrating its vintage rather than trying to hide it with modern design, something I appreciated very much.

For once I remembered to pack my gym kit, so got to make use of the facilities, including the pool. All excellent, and if you're a swimmer the glass roof is a treat, especially at sunrise as the skyscrapers surrounding the hotel are lit up.

I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to rebook this hotel. Highly recommended.<//review><Pics>None< /Pics><Response>None< /Response>< gmapID>

<rate>None</rate>< text>
We just stayed for a week at the Palace and it was perfect. The location in San Francisco is convenient for shopping, restaurants, sightseeing--easy access to everything. The Palace itself is a work of art and architecture. The room had everything--a wonderful bed with luxurious linens, a great shower, lots of electrical outlets, a desk, a refrigerator, a safe, bathrobes. The amenities were the best, and everything was clean and neat. All staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The San Francisco Cotillion was held during our stay and it was magical to see the wonderful young people in their finery. I highly recommend the Palace.</text>
